doc.title: Regional Distribution Engineer
doc.description:
UPPCO seeks a Regional Distribution Engineer to join their team in Ishpeming, Michigan.

This position ensures the safe, reliable and efficient operation of the electric distribution system by applying engineering principles and procedures for the design, construction, operation and maintenance of the system. The Engineer responds to emergency situations and provides direction to field staff and site leaders to optimize outage restoration and safety efforts during normal and after-hours situations. The Engineer must be reasonably available for after-hours call outs and actively participate in the after-hours call out system. This position reports to the Manager of Distribution Engineering.

WHAT WE OFFER.

  • Competitive salary to be based on your knowledge and experience.
  • Comprehensive benefit package.
  • Relocation assistance, if needed.

WHAT YOU WILL DO.

  • Ensure safe operation and reliability of the electric distribution system by providing engineering support and oversight on the design, construction, operation, and maintenance of the system within assigned service area and coverage for other service areas as needed. Partner with Operations for short and long-term planning of the distribution system for reliability and service quality. This includes performing engineering calculations, providing code interpretations, ensuring proper overcurrent protection, construction standards, materials, and procedures are maintained and applied, writing switching procedures, assist with the development and implementation of budgets, training, safety meetings, and initiatives. Assist in emergency response and provide direction to optimize outage restoration efforts. Lead accident investigations involving public contact of energized electric facilities. Assist in emergency response and provide direction to optimize outage restoration efforts.
  • Evaluate customer requirements and distribution system capabilities to optimize the electric facilities serving the customer. This includes transformer sizing and appropriate inventory, conductor sizing, short circuit calculations, overcurrent protection, metering and related issues. Provide technical support for the distribution system including things such as construction standards, failed equipment investigation, ferro resonance, and harmonics. Verifies customer outage records data with the System Operations Center and Distribution Operations to improve reliability indices.
  • Ensure proper operation and maintenance of distribution field equipment such as reclosers, sectionalizers, capacitors, and voltage regulators. Conduct field equipment inspections and collect load data to aid in system planning. Provide equipment and training to other departments within the organization.
  • Provide engineering and technical support for customer issues, system design, power quality, voltage complaints, stray voltage investigations, energy diversions, radio interference, 3rd Party make ready projects, distribution system inspection processes and other similar issues.
  • Participate in corporate initiatives and process improvement efforts on an as-needed basis.
  • Provide indirect leadership and support to the Designer workgroup including Design Tool modifications/updates, development of customer estimates/letters, extension rules interpretation, and project/contractor management.
  • Represent UPPCO as a participant in the local community and outside organizations.

WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR.

  • Bachelor’s degree in Electrical Engineering from an ABET accredited engineering program or equivalent.
  • 3 years’ experience designing, planning, and estimating of electric distribution utility systems preferred.
  • 2 years’ experience with electric utility operations preferred.
  • Project management experience preferred.
  • Michigan Professional Engineer license preferred.
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills with ability to manage a diverse workload and prioritize tasks.
  • Must be reasonably available and responsive to after-hours callouts.
  • Must have a valid driver’s license and the ability to travel (50%) amongst UPPCO’s service territory.
  • Must reside within 30 minutes of UPPCO’s Ishpeming, Michigan Service Center under normal driving conditions.

SOUND LIKE YOU? Take the next step and apply online at the link below.

doc.title: Senior Global Brand Strategy and Development Manager
doc.description:
Senior Global Brand Strategy and Development Manager

TX - Corporate
Corporate
Marketing & Public Relations

Who We Are

At Fossil Group, we dare to dream, disrupt, and deliver in a better way. We are committed to creating great watches, jewelry, and leather goods by investing in technology and long-term value creation. We do this by living out our core values - Authenticity, Grit, Curiosity, Humor and Impact - each and every day, continually powered by purpose and our people. Come be a part of Fossil, where we thrive on diversity, innovation, uniqueness, and inclusion!

Make an Impact

Fossil is transitioning from a world class wholesaler, retailer, manufacturer and designer of products to a “House of Brands” each with their own unique purpose and role in the marketplace.

In order to achieve this transformation we must evolve into experts in consumer needs, brand positioning, brand image and stewards of brand management in the market with consumers to ensure we establish global brand stature, resonance and growth across our portfolio of brands.

You will, by brand, be apart of:

  • Establishing Brand Goals via Brand Health, Consumer and Marketing key performance indicators for select Owned Brands (FOSSIL and SKAGEN)
  • Assist with the identification of right target audience and market opportunity; specifically provide point of view on the size of market / opportunity in the market for each of our brands (see above), in line with marketing investment, consumer / market segmentation, starting point and discrete marketing-led growth initiatives (Partnerships, Brand Extensions, Experiences)
  • Partner with our research team to analyze of our audience to understand critical values that align with our brands
  • Monitor trends in the market and among customers, in order to stay ahead of competitive and market trends providing our brands first-mover advantages and time to pivot to address around them.
  • Support the brand’s foundational strategy; brand positioning guidelines, brand attributes, consumers insights and segment articulation, key messages & comms strategies, product priorities.
  • Support the global messaging strategy (in partnership with IM, PR and Global Social, Design, Merchandising)
  • Align with Merchandising on key product stories and “Big Bets”
  • Annually evaluate what is and isn’t working and provide recommendations to:
    • Shift goals
    • Promote increased global consistency and relevance (regional brand platform development)
    • Make stronger emotional connections
    • Encourage loyalty
    • Learn from our competitors
  • Assist with developing, implementing, and advancing the brand strategy, experience, voice, campaigns, and capabilities of our brands and our portfolio
  • Serve as the global marketing link to the Consumer and Data insights team directing needed surveys or studies to research new positioning, product/category, and messaging strategies (sustainability, creativity, innovation)
  • Serve as the global marketing link to the Creative team - both in shaping distinctive visual identities of each brand and ensuring these are relevant to regional teams and executed consistently globally. Be a resource in the development of campaigns and messaging per brand’s guidelines that you have developed

Your Skills

  • 8-12+ years marketing experience
  • Global experience in designing and translating consumer-driven, distinctive brand positionings and brand platforms for regional requirements
  • Strategic and creative thought leadership (i.e. must be able to distill business, brand and creative insights through analysis and proactively provide solutions and/or a strategic path forward)
  • Ability to evangelize and empathize with our center of the bullseye consumer - making all brand decisions from their point of view' as this will vary in a multi-brand portfolio
  • Requires strong business, creative and marketing skills, creative problem-solving abilities are essential. Analytical skills are also vital for evaluating consumer insights, advertising and marketing campaigns
  • Ability to adapt, take calculated risks, accept ambiguity, test, iterate, and pivot on ideas
  • Ability to collect relevant data and draw conclusions for holistic decision-making
  • Minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Marketing or relevant area of study.
  • Wholesale or consumer brand marketing experience a plus
  • Experience developing marketing and sales presentations using a variety of PC & MAC applications
  • Able to work across all levels of management
  • Skillful self-starter

The Perks

  • Comprehensive benefits packages inclusive of health and well-being services
  • 401(k) match and education on retirement planning
  • Paid parental leave for eligible employees, and a Return Back to Work program for new parents and caregivers to phase back into work on a reduced schedule
  • Generous Paid Time Off including Floating Holidays, Volunteer Time, and Summer Flex Fridays
  • Hybrid working schedules
  • Tuition reimbursement on approved programs
  • Fossil merchandise discounts
  • Career Development Programs

Accommodations Statement

We are committed to creating an inclusive culture and strongly encourage candidates of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer and non-binary people, veterans, parents and individuals with disabilities to apply. If you need accommodations at any point during the interview process please let us know at applicationaccommodation@fossil.com.

doc.title: Director, Driver Engagement
doc.description:
Director, Driver Engagement

For 65 years, Arnold Bros. Transport Ltd. has been providing over the road transportation solutions to customers throughout North America. We specialize in truckload highway transport & logistics management and pride ourselves on going the extra mile to solve our customer’s pressing challenges and deliver exceptional service. We are a multi-generation, family-run company with dedicated staff and drivers, quality equipment and cutting-edge technology. Our head office is in Winnipeg, with locations in Milton, Calgary, and yards in Vancouver, Edmonton, Saskatoon, and Montreal. We pride ourselves on our inclusive family culture and our ability to be creative.

Arnold Bros. Transport Ltd. is seeking an experienced Director, Driver Engagement to join our Leadership Team. This opportunity reports directly to the Chief Human Resources Officer and is ideal for a leader who is energized about creating an engaging experience for our valued Drivers. As a leader, the Director, Driver Engagement will influence meaningful change, open communications, improve performance and foster a culture of trust and safety.

The Director, Driver Engagement is primarily accountable creating an exceptional Driver experience and enabling Driver performance through engagement and retention programs, performance management, training, communications, recognition and equipment assignment.

Key Responsibilities include:

  • Meaningfully differentiates the ABT Driver experience in the Transportation industry.
  • Design and implement programs and communications that connect, enable, and engage Drivers.
  • Design, implement and sustain ABT’s Driver performance management program
  • Contributes to the development of compensation frameworks that recognize driver performance and ensures external competitiveness and internal equity.
  • Delivers and sustains regular Driver recognition programs that celebrate Driver safety, customer service and operational performance.
  • Creates two-way driver communications that informs drivers of company and operational news and provides an opportunity for the Drivers’ voice to be heard and engaged.
  • Works closely with the ABT Academy and Safety & Compliance to design and deliver training and development programs that enhance Driver safety and performance.
  • Delivers an engaging Driver onboarding experience.
  • Oversees efficient and timely Driver equipment Assignment.
  • Works closely with Operations to actively manage the Driver workforce.
  • Participates with the Leadership Team to develop and implement the strategic plan.
  • Develop and effectively manages the Driver Engagement budget.
  • Develop and sustain strong working relationships with external governing bodies and associations.

The successful candidate will have:

  • 10 years of progressive and related experience – Transportation industry experience is an asset.
  • Exceptional team and organizational leadership skills.
  • Excellent verbal, written and interpersonal communication skills.
  • Strong problem-solving skills and creativity.
  • Demonstrated focus on delivering high value and experience to clients.
  • Ability to effectively manage and deliver multiple competing priorities.
  • Ability to develop new ideas and generate buy-in from stakeholders.
  • Ability to prepare clear, concise, and comprehensive reports.
  • Ability to exercise tact and diplomacy in dealing with challenging situations.

Arnold Bros. Transport, offers:

doc.title: Lead Manufacturing Engineer
doc.description:
A Senior Manufacturing Engineer develops, implements and maintains methods, tools, and processes in the manufacture or fabrication of parts, components, sub assemblies and final assemblies. They interface with Design, Test, and Reliability Engineering to create successful product launches and to solve problems. They sustain products with cost reduction and yield improvements.


WORK ENVIRONMENT:

  • Manufacturing Engineers regularly work in office, lab, and manufacturing facilities. Travel to international vendor, manufacturing, and/or development locations may be required.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Performs an integral role on Product Design teams to drive designs that meet all cost and quality goals. Reviews product requirements with design staff to ensure compatibility of processing methods. Performs Design for Manufacturability analysis on new products.
  • Estimates manufacturing costs, determines time standards, and makes recommendations for tooling and process requirements of new or existing product lines.
  • Takes a leadership role in driving Continuous Improvement Projects to elevate product performance in manufacturing.
  • Implements manufacturing-industry best known methods in support of Continuous Improvement Projects to increase efficiency and effectivity of Production. Analyzes work content for distribution to workcenters and capacity requirements.
  • Recommends and prepares changes, additions, and modifications which will facilitate manufacturing


EXPERIENCE:

  • 5+ years of relevant design/development team and/or manufacturing support.
  • Familiar with a variety of the field’s concepts, practices, and procedures.
  • Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals.
  • A wide degree of creativity and latitude is expected.
  • Have strong problem-solving attributes
  • Skilled at communicating with and influencing design teams, vendors, and customers.


Desirable:

  • 6-sigma or equivalent statistical, problem-solving methodology


EDUCATION:

  • Bachelors Degree in a relevant Engineering discipline


COMPENSATION:

As required by multiple state pay transparency laws, Advanced Energy provides a reasonable range of compensation for each job posting. Actual compensation is influenced by an array of factors including, but not limited to, skill set, level of experience, and specific office location. The range of starting pay for this role is $100,000 to $135,000 per year.


BENEFITS:

As part of our total rewards philosophy, we believe in offering and maintaining competitive compensation and benefits programs for our employees to attract and retain a talented, highly engaged workforce. Our compensation programs are focused on equitable, fair pay practices including market-based base pay, an annual pay-for-performance incentive plan, and discounted Employee Stock Purchase Plan.


In addition to our competitive compensation practices, we offer a strong benefits package in each of the countries in which we operate. In the U.S., we offer a rich benefits package that includes:


  • Medical - 4 different health care plan options, dental, and vision
  • Short and long-term disability and life insurance
  • Health savings and flexible spending accounts
  • Generous paid time off starting at 4 weeks, 7 holidays and 3 floating holidays
  • 8 hours of paid volunteer time off
  • 8 weeks of paid parental leave for both Moms and Dads
  • Company matched 401(k)
  • Tuition reimbursement
  • Expanded mental health coverage and employee assistance programs
  • Other voluntary benefits include pet insurance, identify theft, legal assistance, critical illness, and voluntary accident insurance


Advanced Energy is committed to diversity in its workforce including Equal Employment Opportunity for Minorities, Females, Protected Veterans, and Individuals with Disabilities.

doc.title: Retail Assistant (Home Accessories)
doc.description:
Who We Are
Big things are happening at Sterling Furniture! As Scotland’s largest family owned furniture and homewares retailing group and with over 40 years of market experience, our aim is to continue sourcing the highest quality on-trend products so the customer can find everything relating to the home under one roof. In 2019, we opened our first brand new concept store ‘Sterling Home’ in Uddingston, Glasgow to enormous success. In 2020, we followed up with refurbishing and rebranding our Dunfermline, Glasgow, and Edinburgh stores to the same standard, and recently reopened our newly refurbished Aberdeen store. As we build on decades of knowledge, this is a fantastic opportunity to assist in shaping the future of our business while influencing the furniture and homewares retail sector within Scotland – there’s never been a better time to join the Sterling Furniture family.

Role
To help customers identify and purchase products they desire, ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction through excellent sales service is delivered. Full time including weekends.

Responsibilities
  • Provide a high class customer service and increase company growth and revenue through sales
  • Manage point of sale processes
  • Maintain outstanding store condition and visual merchandising standards
  • Assist with sales process by maintaining a fully stocked store

  • Customer service focus
  • Friendly, engaging and helpful personality
Education
  • Standard Educational Grades
What do we offer?
  • Competitive salary
  • Pension plan
  • Generous holidays
  • Staff discount
  • Free parking
  • Friendly, modern working environment

doc.title: Field Sales Executive (On-Trade) - Sheffield and Doncaster
doc.description:
Sheffield and Doncaster

Are you an outstanding customer service professional who thirsts for more? Do you have the ambition and drive to forge a path in the world of field sales with one of the biggest names in the cider-making world? If so, read on.

Who are Thatchers Cider?

Established in 1904 by William John Thatcher, we have grown into one of the top cider-making businesses in the world. Now in our fourth generation of family cider makers, we’re exceptionally proud of our Somerset roots.

We’ve experienced tremendous growth through industry-leading levels of investment in our marketing, people development, innovative technology and world-class cider mill. The best part? We’re just getting started.

We’re now looking for a Field Sales Executive to join our brilliant team and grow awareness of our brand and incredible products throughout Sheffield and Doncaster.

What are the perks?

  • Competitive salary
  • Comprehensive benefits including bonus, company car, pension, laptop and phone
  • Discounts in our cider shop (after all, you’ll need to know just how good our cider is!)
  • Join our Thatchers Cider Sales Academy
This is an amazing opportunity to become part of the Thatchers success story and take on an exciting role where no two days are the same.

We’ll provide you with a tailored training and development programme that will result in you gaining industry-leading sales training. We will assess your skills and ambitions at the start of the journey and create an individualised programme that will play to your strengths and support areas of development.

You will also have the chance to utilise skill development tools and a range of business seminars and networking opportunities that will equip you with abilities and insight into our industry and the company.

Our team are action-oriented, adaptable and resourceful and we have delivered success after success in a highly competitive marketplace. We have a thirst for knowledge, a passion for quality cider and a commitment to delighting our customers.

We work hard and, together, we achieve great things. If you think you have the passion to make an impact as part of the Thatchers family, this is the role for you.

What will I be doing?

As a Field Sales Executive, you’ll drive awareness of the Thatchers brand throughout Sheffield, Doncaster and the surrounding area to increase the distribution and availability of our award-winning ciders.

In this exciting role, you will:
  • Identify new opportunities to increase product distribution
  • Enhance customer/consumer engagement through tours, tastings, events, product placement and POS (point of sale) support
  • Create and build excellent working relationships across your customer base
As part of your role, you will occasionally need to undertake overnight stays.

What will I need to join the team?

To become one of our Field Sales Executives, you’ll need:
  • Customer service experience
  • Interpersonal skills
  • Pragmatism
  • Relationship/rapport building skills
  • Presentation and communication skills
  • Strong organisation skills and the ability to manage your time
  • To be analytical and numerate
  • An adaptable nature
  • A good level of IT literacy
  • A full, valid driving licence
We’d love to hear from you if you’ve previously worked as a Business Development Manager, Brand Manager, Wholesale Sales Executive, Customer Service Executive, Bartender, Front of House Assistant, Bar Manager, Retail Assistant, Retail Manager, Waiter, Waitress, Customer Care Rep, Customer Service Rep, or Customer Services Representative.

This is the perfect role if you are looking to become a Sales Executive, Field Sales Executive, Business Development Executive, BDE, Junior Sales Representative, or Sales Rep.

Webrecruit and Thatchers Cider are equal opportunities employers, value diversity and are strongly committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all employees and all applicants for employment. Equal opportunities are the only acceptable way to conduct business and we believe that the more inclusive our environments are, the better our work will be.

So, if you’re seeking your next opportunity as a Field Sales Executive, please apply via the button shown. This vacancy is being advertised by Webrecruit. The services advertised by Webrecruit are those of an Employment Agency.

doc.title: Student Placement – Commercial (12 Month FTC)
doc.description:
Liverpool with remote working and travel
£22,000 Plus Pension, BUPA Medical Cash Plan, Life Assurance, 20 Days’ Holiday (rising with service)

This is an amazing opportunity to help make a difference and save the planet by making a positive impact in a ground-breaking business who truly put safety at the heart of everything we do and have big plans for the future.

Olleco is on a mission to help protect the planet, working together with thousands of foodservice businesses to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by hundreds and thousands of tonnes. We are now looking for an individual to join us on their placement year and help us to continue to do things the right way for customers, colleagues and the planet.

With over 1,000 colleagues in multiple sites nationwide delivering excellent performance, we supply premium cooking oils, and collect organic waste, which is then converted into bio-methane, electricity, heat and organic fertiliser. We offer the human touch with local, community-based depots which seek to give back to those communities every chance we get.

Within a diverse and inclusive environment, you will have the chance to contribute to our H&S culture and help us maintain our reputation for operational excellence.

As a Student Placement based at our Liverpool facility, you will be a fundamental part of our team, enabling us to continue with our mission to serve the planet, a purpose we care strongly about and are committed to. You will be joining us for your placement year at university for a 12 month fixed term contract.

Why join us?

  • You’ll have the opportunity to make a difference, help us to become more successful and deliver more benefits to the environment
  • We’re growing and so will you be able to develop your own career
  • We provide opportunities for you to develop your career, we encourage continuous learning and pride ourselves on promoting from within
  • Help us achieve even more amazing things
What do we expect of each other?

  • That each of us act like owners of this growing business
  • We collaborate to enable us to be the best we can be – especially when it comes to safety and wellbeing!
  • We are committed to making food sustainable and ensuring that nothing is wasted so we encourage our colleagues to come forward with their ideas
  • Focus on the things that matter and approach every situation proactively and with agility
This is the role that’s on offer for the right person:
  • The chance to gain real experience in a successful professional environment
  • Great training and support throughout your placement
  • Get ahead of your classmates before you have even gained your degree!
A little bit more about the role:
  • Support with a broad variety of project work
  • Learn how to investigate, analyse, visualise, articulate, and solve problems and concepts
  • Support with identifying and evaluating a range of business opportunities
  • Assist with data analysis including internal performance metrics, and market studies
  • Learn how to build a business case and payback models
  • Support with public affairs activities
  • Review and summarise market and commercial data
  • Carry out administrative tasks
Interested?

What are we looking for? As you can imagine, you’ll need a broad range of personal skills to succeed, but we don’t expect you to have everything from the start! We will coach, train and support you, it’s more important that you have the right interpersonal skills and the intelligence to grasp our business and take us forward.

We will be looking for:
  • An individual studying a STEM, economics or business-related degree
  • To be predicated a 2:1 or above and have completed the second year of the course
  • Experience in analysing data, drawing conclusions and presenting outcomes
  • The willingness to undertake personal development and training
  • A highly motivated individual with a self-starting mentality
  • A structured and analytical approach
  • Passion and enthusiasm
To apply for this Student Placement, please apply via the button shown.

Other organisations may call this opportunity an Internship, Commercial Intern, Graduate Trainee, Training Internship, Commercial Internship, Placement Year, or Placement Internship.

doc.title: Content Planner
doc.description:
Do you have a passion for food and photography? We have a fantastic role working for Asda Head Office in the Photography Content Team. You will be part of a team responsible for delivering fantastic food photography for the business, across campaigns, in store and online.

Ideal location: Leeds, United Kingdom, LS11

Hybrid working available, with Asda's Office based in Leeds.

Salary: Up to £32,000 per annum

What you’ll do in the role:

  • The role will closely work with Asda's internal campaign team and our agencies (internal and external) to understand creative big idea and strategy, campaign development and principles. You will do this with the aim to drive campaign consistencies through to our photography assets.
  • Gain a deep understanding of creative briefs and shoot requirements. From this you will formulate an approach to capturing photography, to deliver against the brief across a multitude of channels – POS, online, OOH, press and social.
  • You will be the voice of Asda across campaign shoots when liaising with agencies.
  • Ensuring product information is shared with agencies to immerse them in the product and samples are ordered and supplied on time.
  • Working with and inspiring a roster of agencies and in house teams via creative briefs with perspective and clarity.
  • Keep up to speed with trends across photography, adding perspective, innovation, and analysis to drive decisions and direction.
  • Implement and grow Asda’s photography guardrails and guidelines to drive photography consistencies, to create a recognisable and inspirational brand look and feel for Asda.
  • Ensure campaigns are measured and reported against agreed objectives and KPI’s, with insights and recommends for future campaigns, through pulling together thorough evaluations.

What we need from you:

  • Agency or client background with experience managing creative projects
  • Strong eye for detail and passion for creative
  • A proven track record in agency management
  • Strong knowledge of what makes for effective and engaging content
  • Ability to innovate and think outside the box
  • Excellent communication and influencing skills
  • Ability to manage and inspire agencies
  • Ability to lead a team to land projects within reactive timescales

Why work for us:
This is a great role which will give you a wealth of experience into how various areas of our business work. You will have the opportunity to work with many key stakeholders, including those at senior level. If you are a great team player, who is customer focused and are curious to find out more, then don’t delay apply today!

#LI-CC1

doc.title: Revised* (2) Technology and AV Support Specialist
doc.description:
JobID: 666

    Position Type:
    Technology/Miscellaneous/Technology Support Specialist
    Date Posted:
    3/31/2023
    Location:
    Pottsgrove High School
    Date Available:
    ASAP
    Closing Date:
    05/12/2023



    Title: (2) Technology and AV Support Specialist

    Reports To: Director of Technology
    Job Summary: Provide technology integration support at the building level as it relates to hardware, software, and training in connection with district initiatives.

    Primary Duties and Responsibilities:
    • Provide assistance to classroom teachers in technology operations and software use and in the facilitation of technology in instructional settings as needed.
    • Troubleshoot and resolve end-user needs in the areas of desktop support, classroom technology and building office technology in district buildings. Equipment to support includes, but is not limited to computers, laptops, projectors, printers, scanners, document cameras etc.
    • Install and configure software and test software installations according to district protocol.
    • Support educational software/apps, administrative software/apps and web-based resources as appropriate in line with the building and district initiatives and outlined use.
    • Utilize work request system to maintain records of all problems and resolutions relative to client computers and other technology systems and software.
    • Assist with staff development as necessary.
    • Maintain and support the lighting equipment in the building auditorium. This includes being the point person to operate the lighting board, setup necessary lighting instruments etc in the auditorium (house and stage) when requested by internal and external parties.
    • Maintain and support the sound equipment in the building auditorium. This includes being the point person to operate the sound board, setup microphones when requested by internal and external parties.
    • Maintain sound and lighting equipment using best practice measures as prescribed by the supporting vendor or manufacturer.
    • Support necessary AV equipment requests throughout the building (i.e. for presenters, events etc).
    • Assist with setup and breakdown of computer systems for various purposes including routine maintenance and presentations.
    • Perform maintenance and repairs on assigned equipment as needed.
    • Performs other duties as assigned by the Director of Technology.
    Qualifications:
    • Two (2) years experience in technology support and/or applications preferably in public education
    • High School Diploma
    • Ability to learn new technology independently
    • Working knowledge of computer operating systems, office software, educational software and Internet
    • Familiarity with teacher grading software and student data/electronic report card systems
    • Experience with desktops, laptops, printers and wireless technology in an educational setting
    • Must have current Act 34, 151 & 114 clearances
    Location: 2 full-time openings: one position at Pottsgrove High School and one position at Pottsgrove Middle School
    Salary: $20.00 - $22.41 per hour/ 7.5 hours per day/ 260 work days per school year
    Benefits: Competitive healthcare including medical with Independence Blue Cross, prescription, dental, vision, retirement through PSERS, and paid personal/sick/vacation days upon hiring.

doc.title: Customer Service Agent - Travel (UK Market)
doc.description:
Are you looking for a job and do you speak native or fluent English? We offer you the opportunity to work in a multinational company.

We seek to incorporate agents to the International team of (Travel) Customer Service located in the city of Barcelona.

If you enjoy working in an international, teamwork and fast changing environment join the Travel Customer Service team!


How will be your day by day with us?

The Travel Customer Service Specialist implements the necessary means for the service and coordinates the assistance operations, while offers the best solutions to our clients by mobilizing our networks and teams of experts.

The Travel Customer Service Specialist finds a focused solution on the client, with great digital orientation. The main tasks are:

  • To know in detail the different type of policies of our clients and apply the corresponding conditions in each case
  • Advice and orient customers towards an appropriate solution of their cases, offering a rapid and tailored customer care response to their problems, in line with the coverage guaranteed under the customers' policy
  • Dealing with different customer types with confidence irrespective of their status, culture or behaviour
  • Coordinate all necessary actions to resolve client's requests: handle international telephone calls and emails, register cases and document actions into our computer based system, organize appropriate action and ensure the closure of each file
  • Encourage close working liaison between operations & internal teams by: Giving clear case management plans, explaining client's situations to staff, clients and customers as required.
  • Advising on medical claims decisions when necessary actively adding to safe, cost effective service delivery
  • Encouraging excellent communications to all job interfaces
  • Ensuring that all protocols for the delivery of world class customer service are kept current, compliant with regulation and that they are adhered to.

#LI-SP


Your Profile


The Job is perfect for you if you have:

  • Ability to effectively communicate in english. A high level in spanish is desirable.
  • The sensitivity and empathy to deal with customers who may be distressed by their medical problems and/or those of their relatives.
  • Excellent customer service skills.
  • Willingness to take initiative and use judgement to solve problems and case work
  • Excellent organisational and time management skills
  • Ability to demonstrate a highly professional work ethic in line with core AXA values and AXA Leadership Framework behaviours
  • Flexibility
  • The ability to get things done / deliver results to agreed customer standards
  • Computer literate. (Including using Word and Excel)
  • Excellent keyboard/talking & typing skills
  • Pressure absorption, at times you will be under a great deal of pressure through seasonal workloads. You will need to be able to deal with situations calmly and still focus on delivering great service.
  • Team skills, you will need to work with several departments to ensure that you support the department in reaching its full potential, so it is essential that you are able to communicate efficiently with each department and demonstrate flexibility in this role.

About AXA

AXA Group is the world leader in insurance and asset management. We protect and advise our clients at every step in their lives, by offering products and services which satisfy their needs in the areas of insurance, personal protection, saving and asset management. AXA is the leading insurance brand worldwide, with over 100 million clients. We are transforming from payer to partner for our client, with a strong focus on risk prevention.

Our mission: Empower people to live a better life.

Our values: Customer First, Courage, Integrity and One AXA.

About the Entity

AXA Partners is an AXA transversal business unit offering a wide range of solutions in assistance services, travel insurance and credit protection.

AXA Partners’ role is also to implement innovative solutions emerging from the AXA Innovation unit.

Combining passion with advanced expertise, we design and deliver worldwide solutions for partners and communities. We protect what matters, when it matters.

What We Offer

By joining AXA Partners, you will work in a responsible company, which offers a real culture of expertise & diversity. Our focus is on accelerating the development of everyone’s skills, whilst offering attractive and competitive compensation and opportunities for professional development and growth.

Additionally, at AXA, we work to make a real difference to people - when amazing things happen and when we create opportunities for a better life, the feeling of pride is extraordinary.

doc.title: Procurement Specialist: FTC 6-9 Months
doc.description:
Procurement Specialist: FTC 6-9 Months

Description
We are looking for a Procurement professional with minimum of 4 years’ experience to join our team and support global Procurement activities. The person needs to be self-motivated and have a strong knowledge of end-to-end Procurement Process. Working to and supporting the enforcement of the procurement process for equipment, services and supplies is a key requirement of this role. A strong negotiator with a track- record in delivering savings and improved terms. The Procurement Specialist will also have responsibility administering purchasing initiatives, or projects as they occur and ensure Procurement Policy and Procedures are adhered. The position reports directly to the Procurement Director with routine interactions with Legal, Accounting, Department managers and company Executives.

Responsibilities

  • Provide cost savings through Vendor negotiations.
  • On-board new vendors and maintain vendor records.
  • Negotiate commercial terms and collaborate with in-house legal to deliver agreements that meet Imperva needs.
  • Build, maintain and manage vendor relationships through effective communication.
  • Identify, select, evaluate and develop vendors based on spend analysis, market conditions, contract expirations, etc.
  • Collaborate with internal departments to provide business support analysis and meet Service Level Agreement (SLA) targets.
  • Assess and validate current and future supplier capabilities to ensure Imperva are working with the best vendors that deliver on pricing, quality and service requirements.
  • Play a key role in any new projects or initiatives to improve procurement function.
  • Meet key KPI’s as set to develop skills within the role and meet overall team/company objectives.
  • Manage the conversion of system requisitions to Purchase orders on a daily basis.
  • Assist in the resolution of any Vendor invoice queries raised by AP team.
  • Ensure Purchase order system is up to date and monthly review of open Orders met to support financial accrual process.
  • Maintain purchase order workflow to ensure appropriate expense/capital coding and reporting consistency.
  • Lead purchasing cost analysis and vendor RFP process.
  • Provide support to Procurement Director as required.

Qualifications and Skills


  • Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Accounting or related field or working towards procurement qualification.
  • Strong analytical, problem solving and negotiating experience.
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  • Good collaboration skills, works well with cross functional areas, team player.
  • Computer literate and knowledgeable in MS Office Suite, experienced with Purchasing/Finance packages (preferably on NetSuite).


Our Company:
Imperva is an analyst-recognized, cybersecurity leader—championing the fight to secure data and applications wherever they reside. Once deployed, our solutions proactively identify, evaluate, and eliminate current and emerging threats, so you never have to choose between innovating for your customers and protecting what matters most. Imperva—Protect the pulse of your business. Learn more: www.imperva.com, our blog, on Twitter.
Rewards:
Imperva offers a competitive compensation package that includes base salary, medical, flexible time off and more. It’s an exciting time to work in the security space. Check out our products and services at www.imperva.com and career opportunities at www.imperva.com/careers

Legal Notice:

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, protected veteran status, medical condition or disability, or any other characteristic protected by law.

doc.title: Process Engineer
doc.description:
Summary

Systemic Bio is a 3D Systems subsidiary based in Houston, TX, focused on developing human vascularized organ and disease models for drug discovery and development. Founded in August 2022 with a $15M seed investment from its parent company, Systemic Bio uses its proprietary bioprinting and organ-on-a-chip technology to accelerate drug development timelines, increase clinical trial success rates, and eventually put an end to animal testing.

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Process Engineer to join our Lab Operations team. The Process Engineer will play a crucial role in creating, executing, and optimizing manufacturing processes for our bioprinted components and products. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in process engineering, a deep understanding of bioprinting technology, and a passion for revolutionizing drug discovery and development.

Responsibilities

  • Develop, execute, and optimize manufacturing processes for producing printed and bioprinted components and products.
  • Troubleshoot process-related issues and implement improvements to enhance efficiency, quality, and scalability.
  • Develop and maintain operational processes and documentation, ensuring industry standards and regulatory compliance.
  • Qualify equipment, materials, processes, and protocols for successful production, including performance testing, verification, and validation activities.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including R&D, Quality Assurance, and Lab Operations, to ensure seamless integration of new processes and products.
  • Continuously monitor and analyze process performance data, identify areas for improvement, and implement corrective actions as needed.
  • Stay current with advancements in bioprinting technology and related fields to drive innovation and maintain a competitive edge.
Qualifications


Experience

  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Engineering, Biomedical Engineering, Bioengineering, or a related field.
  • Minimum 3 years of experience in process engineering, preferably in a life science, pharmaceutical, or biomedical industry

Knowledge, Skills & Abilities

  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs to facilitate the movement, installation, deployment, or shipping of equipment and supplies

  • Excellent problem-solving, analytical, and troubleshooting skills.
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Self-motivated, detail-oriented, and able to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate ideas and information clearly, effectively, and frequently (verbal and written)
  • Facility with appropriate word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, and related standard software

Preferred

A Master's degree (MS) is a plus

doc.company_name: Texas Dept of Licensing and Regulation
doc.title: Staff Services Officer III #0323-23
doc.description:
PLEASE COMPLETE A STATE OF TEXAS APPLICATION TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS POSITION.

Job Description

The Assets and Operations Coordinator is selected by and responsible to the Chief of Staff and works closely with the Asset Manager and Operations Project Manager. The Assets and Operations Coordinator performs complex staff services work. Work involves receiving, inspecting, arranging, delivering, and transferring warehouse inventory and agency assets from acquisition to disposal. Assists with the development, maintenance and implementation of fleet and asset management policies and procedures; and, with the completion of required fleet and asset management reporting and auditing processes. Serves as the agency’s alternate property manager. Works closely with the agency’s Asset Manager and Operations Project Manager, assisting with the maintenance, safety, security and risk mitigation of agency office and warehouse space including performing operational checks on equipment/vehicles. Ensures compliance with established security requirements and loss prevention controls, and procedures. May provide guidance to others. Works under general supervision, with moderate latitude for the use of initiative and independent judgment. Significant travel between agency locations in Austin and occasional travel outside of the Austin area required.

Essential Duties

Ø Plans, coordinates and performs daily warehouse operations, including requisitioning, receiving, inspecting, and allocating resources, to ensure that duties are carried out in accordance with applicable regulations, policies, and procedures.

Ø Reviews fiscal expenditure reports, purchase orders, receipts, and vendor invoices for accuracy.

Ø Prepares, transports, and delivers warehouse inventory to end users.

Ø Serves as alternate property manager and assists with the assigning, tracking, auditing, and surplusing of agency-controlled and non-controlled assets in the Comptroller of Public Account’s (CPA) CAPPS/SPA systems.

Ø Assists with the delivery and pickup of fleet equipment and pool vehicles, including performing operational checks on equipment/vehicles.

Ø May perform facilities management functions such as submitting work order requests and monitoring the entry and security systems.

Ø May assist in the developing, maintaining and implementing of standards and procedures for assigned area to ensure compliance with legislative and agency requirements.

Ø Assists with the completion of reports on fleet equipment performance metrics with the Comptroller of Public Account’s (CPA) Office of Vehicle Fleet Management (OVFM).

Ø Coordinates special projects to ensure that project goals and objectives are met.

Ø Assists the Operations Project Manager with the agency’s buildings and as a point of contact for building repair and maintenance of TDLR office and warehouse space. Facilitates repairs and maintenance through the Texas Facilities Commission (TFC) and/or other appropriate building contact and/or vendor.

Ø Assists in developing policies and procedures; and assists in interpreting and ensuring compliance with applicable federal, state, and local laws, rules, and regulations.

Ø Assists with analyzing internal processes and recommending and implementing procedural or policy changes to improve operations.

Ø Coordinates with agency staff, consumers, government officials, other state agencies, and other interested parties regarding warehouse operations and other assigned program activities.

Ø May plan and conduct asset/fleet workshops and/or training programs.

Ø Complies with division, agency, and/or position specific training requirements.

Ø Keeps management appropriately informed of ongoing activities and critical matters affecting the operation and well-being of the agency.

Ø Demonstrates a spirit of teamwork offering positive and constructive ideas, encouragement, and support, to other members of staff and team, while upholding the agency’s core values.

Ø Adheres to all Texas Department of Licensing and Regulation Personnel Policies and performs related work as assigned.

Minimum Requirements

Four (4) years of experience in warehouse operations, property accounting, inventory management, purchasing and/or related work required. Experience performing these duties in a state agency environment preferred. Experience with SPA and/or CAPPS Financials preferred. Ability to drive an agency and/or personal vehicle required. Must possess a valid class C driver’s license, proof of auto liability insurance and an acceptable driving record from the Department of Public Safety. Ability to move up to 50 lbs. without assistance and up to 100 lbs. with assistance.

**Must obtain a valid Class “A” (CDL) driver’s license within 6 months of employment.

The successful candidate will have: Knowledge of principles and practices of fleet operations management; of fleet equipment operations; and, of applicable federal, state, and local laws and regulations. Knowledge of relevant agency policies and procedures; information technology needs; Working knowledge of warehousing and inventory methods and procedures, including strategic packing methods to maximize delivery trips. Skill in the use of computer and applicable software, including MS Office applications and CAPPS Financials and, in standard office equipment and mobile devices. Skill in oral and written communication; in managing multiple priorities simultaneously; in coordinating activities, and, in critical thinking. Skill in evaluating new equipment, goods, and service performance; in evaluating unit expenditures; and, in anticipating and adjusting for problems. Skill in operation of a forklift and pallet lift/jack, and other warehouse machinery. Ability to gather, assemble, correlate, and analyze facts; and, to devise solutions to problems. Ability to prepare concise reports; to develop and evaluate procedures; and, to read/interpret related technical materials and to make on-site assessments. Ability to interpret and clearly explain complex statutes, rules, procedures, and technical requirements; to establish and maintain effective working relationships; and, to communicate effectively verbally and in writing. Ability to provide friendly, caring service to others; to supervise and train personnel.

doc.title: Engineering Internship
doc.description:
Engineering Internship

Bowling Green, OH, Tiffin, OH, and Tupelo, MS

Internship Overview:

The purpose of the Grammer Americas Internship Program is to develop the leaders of tomorrow, innovators with the drive to make a positive impact in a rapidly changing world, and build the confidence needed to enter into a full-time career upon graduation.

Grammer Interns have the opportunity to work on projects that provide valuable real-world experiences and development. Through these projects, interns will have a measurable impact on the business and be mentored, coached, and work side by side with experienced Grammer leaders.

Your experience will be customized based on your developmental goals and no two roles will be the same. At Grammer, we recognize that every person brings something unique to the table and we intend to provide opportunities to maximize on those unique goals and skillsets.

The internship will conclude with a formal presentation where students will present their success stories to the leaders of the organization and receive feedback on their performance.

Company Description:

Grammer is specialized in developing and manufacturing components and systems for car interiors as well as driver and passenger seats for off-road vehicles, trucks, buses, and trains.
As a global partner to the vehicle manufacturing industry we are represented around the world by our two divisions, Automotive and Commercial Vehicles. Our employees are constantly engaged in developing and producing innovative, flexible solutions to meet challenges in today’s competitive global market. Grammer can be found on four continents with more than 50 production, distribution and logistics sites in 20 countries.

Culture:

Here at Grammer, we foster a culture that embraces our Grammer CODE: Collaborate in an inclusive environment, Openness in communication and ideas, Drive for results with energy and Empower yourself and others by taking ownership of decisions and actions.

What we are looking for:
Grammer is looking for full-time, onsite Engineering Interns to join our Engineering teams at our production facilities in Tiffin, OH, Bowling Green, OH, and Tupelo, MS. The ideal candidate will enjoy working in a team environment, have the drive to create positive change, and the desire to learn and gain valuable industry experience. This individual will have an opportunity to make lasting and positive changes in our Engineering teams and Grammer as a whole!

What you will be doing:

  • Hands on and project based work supporting Grammer business goals
  • Provide a “fresh eyes” approach while working with Engineers on developing and implementing processes that would drive improvements to safety, scrap reduction, production efficiency, and more.
  • Develop understanding of Tier 1 Automotive and Commercial Vehicle manufacturing, lean manufacturing, root cause analysis, continuous improvement, Kaizen principles, and more.
  • Develop ability to work in a cross-functional team, including quality, manufacturing, production, purchasing, and potentially external customers.
  • Enhance problem-solving skills through interaction with team members and customer interactions.
  • Work with engineering personnel to design, assemble, improve scrap, reduce “waste” and continuously improve our products.
  • Prepares reports/documentation that will be communicated within Engineering and/or other departments.
  • Analyze data, develop presentations, and present to all levels of the organization
  • Provide support for continuous improvement initiatives, companywide.
  • Exposure and partnership on 5S projects
  • Utilization of engineering related software
  • Complete an internship project and present it to leadership at the conclusion of the internship.
  • Other duties assigned as needed

What you will bring along:

  • Currently working on completion of a Bachelors or Masters degree in Engineering
  • Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without Company sponsorship now and in the future
  • Desire to gain experience in the engineering function of a manufacturing environment
  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
  • Strong mechanical and analytical skills
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong organization and project management skills
  • Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and schematics
  • Detail oriented and analytical mindset
  • Desire to learn, develop skillsets, and be mentored
  • Comfortable with Word, PowerPoint, and Excel

Job Type: Full-time

Schedule:

  • 8 hour shift
  • Monday to Friday

Work setting:

  • In-person
  • Manufacturing facility

Ability to commute/relocate:

  • Tiffin, OH: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Required)

Work Location: In person

doc.title: Laundry Aide
doc.description:
Summary:
Under general supervision but according to established policies and procedures performs the duties listed below.

Responsibilities:Distribution:
Assembles racks of clean linen.

Distributes clean linen to area clinics using linen baskets.

Takes orders for linen from personnel on units and by phone.

Picks up soiled linen from various hospital clinics using linen baskets.

Linen Sorting:
Using universal precautions (personal protective equipment) sorts linen into like categories for eventual washing.

Linen Folding:
Visually inspects all clean linen for any imperfections then folds and places in proper racks in preparation for delivery.

Separates missed re-wash linen. Folds and places in exchange carts for delivery.

Folds Pediatric patient linen and places in exchange carts for delivery.

Folds patient gowns towels isolation gowns and under pads using automatic folding machine.

Surgical Linen:
Sorts linen and carefully inspects each piece for stains tears or any other damage.

Patches small holes with patching machine. Refers others to sewing room for repair or condemns piece if beyond repair.

Folds each piece of linen in a precise way and stocks shelves.

Assembles various types of kits and surgical packs with precise numbers of surgical linen in each kit or pack.

Takes order for linen from personnel on units and by phone.

Linen Assembly:
Takes orders via the phone.

Assembles exchange carts with linen for units requiring specific number and kinds of linen.

Performs linen return and re-assembly calculations in order to accurately prep user area carts for next delivery.

Bags washed clothes and fitted sheets going to user areas.

Ironing:
Feeds linen into mechanical spreader which prepares sheets to be fed into the ironer.

Works in a team of four and rotates positions on the ironer.

Switches ironer key pad function in order to process flat sheets draw sheets pillow cases cubicle curtains and bath blankets.

Stands at the cross folding machine receiving folded items as they come off the ironer. Counts items and assembles carts with accurate par.

Visually inspects items while feeding and folding. Separates those that are stained torn or damaged.

Sewing:
Makes mends and repairs such items as drapes specialty sheets collars and slings.

Makes alterations for proper fit of uniforms.

Uniform Room:
Issues uniforms to hospital employees assuring correct size and fit.

Prepares name tapes or other identification markers as appropriate.

Keeps records of uniforms issued to employees.

Feeds lab coats and uniforms into the steam tunnel machine.

Sorts linen items being ragged out and keeps a count by piece and type of items being removed from the system.

Pins hems sleeves etc. in preparation for alterations.

Other information:BASIC KNOWLEDGE:
Ability to follow precise instructions for folding and counting correct number of pieces.

Knowledge of clothes and materials when working the sewing area.

Ability to read and write English.

Clerical and numerical ability to maintain simple records count inventory and take orders from linen by telephone.

EXPERIENCE:
A minimum of one year sewing experience is required (sewing room only).

WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Physical ability to lift loads of wet or dry linen push/pull linen racks and bins of soiled linen and lift bundles.

Physical ability to visually inspect materials.

Physical ability to feed folding equipment and sewing machines.

Physical ability to use brooms etc. to maintain work area in a clean and safe fashion.

Exposure to unpleasant odors from solid linens lint and heat.

Walking standing lifting (heavy & light loads) bending and carrying/pushing.

Exposure to extreme hot and cold temperatures in the work area and noise from the machines.

Standing on safety ladders to reach uniforms and assemble linen carts.

Walking lifting (heavy & light) bending carrying and pushing.

Chance of burns and other injury while working with equipment and machines.

Chance of injury is minimized with adherence to current safety precautions.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: None

doc.title: Housekeeping Aide
doc.description:
Summary:
Under supervision and following established procedures performs a variety of heavy cleaning duties in order to maintain the hospital in an orderly sanitary and attractive condition for patients personnel and visitors.

Responsibilities:
Must have classroom and on the job training of floor carpet upholstery waste disposal operating room and chemical handling procedures and learn proper operation and cleaning of E.S.D. equipment.

Shampoos carpets upholstery and refinishes floors following E.S.D. procedures using manual and motorized devices.

Dusts high vents lights pipes lockers ceilings and washes window glass throughout the hospital complex using ladders or other safety devices.

Cleans miscellaneous items such as wastebaskets television sets fans rubber mats etc.

Washes disinfects all sinks toilets floors urinals bedpan racks bathtubs showers in hospital lavatories. Services and refills all soap and paper dispensers.

Washes walls either manually or using mechanical devices.

Prepares all burn and Radiation (I-131) rooms by laying protective covering.

Cleans dust washes and disinfects from top to bottom all beds mattresses sleeping carts through out the hospital complex.

Picks up and disposes of rubbish and soiled linen from patient floors and deposits down chute transports to laundry or places in rubbish truck as appropriate.

Removes rubbish from rubbish chute room transports heavy rubbish via trash carts for disposal of waste boxes waste when required boxes chemo waste makes chemical pick-up when needed. Washes rubbish chute rooms top to bottom with a pressure sprayer. Washes rubbish trucks using the truck washer or manually with a water hose. Performs minor services to trucks such as replace screws and grease wheels. Operates bailer equipment for bailing boxes and transporting recycle totes to trailer.

Washes or spot cleans walls and polishes woodwork all furniture brass fittings and stainless steel elevator doors kick plates etc.

Removes and transports animal waste and soiled linens to rubbish truck.

Transports mattresses office and patient room furniture including beds cribs folding tables etc. as necessary. May assist nursing personnel in moving beds and patient furniture for various reasons.

Cleans dirt snow and salt from sidewalks and entrances to all buildings on the hospital complex using manual or powered equipment tools. Cleans entrance mats applies salt to entrances as needed and assists Facilities Management grounds crew during inclement weather.

Changes cubicle curtains and draperies. Removes and washes window blinds and makes repairs to same.

Cleans from top to bottom all construction areas after renovations are completed.

Required to carry and use a beeper or a two-way radio upon request.

Assists supply clerks in supply room or equipment room. Services batteries on all battery operated devices. Makes conference room set-ups for meetings parties etc. Performs the duties of supply clerks during their absence.

Takes laundry linen inventory by physically counting pieces of linen and documenting results on appropriate forms.

May perform Housekeeping Aide I and Laundry Aide II duties as required.

Performs other duties as assigned by the supervisor or group leader

Other information:BASIC KNOWLEDGE:
Has the ability to follow instruction and observe safety precautions.

Has the ability to prepare solutions according to procedure.

Has the ability to assemble cleaning equipment such as mops dusters vacuum cleaners mop buckets and ringers.

Has the ability to read write understand and speak English as well as ability to count numbers.

Has the ability to operate control and clean motorized and manual equipment that is required to perform E.S.D. tasks.

Has the ability to perform all duties in a safe and professional manner and in accordance with established Environmental Department and Fleet Risk Control policies and procedures.

Has the physical ability to lift carry or push equipment such as floor buffers wet vacuums wall-washing machine automatic floor-washing machine carpet cleaning equipment rubbish carts and linen carts transport patients office furniture climb ladders and shovel show.

EXPERIENCE:
At least one to three months on the job training plus formal and on going classroom training.

WORK ENVIRONMENT AND PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:
Continuous walking standing carrying pushing trash carts weighting up to 400 pounds stooping lifting climbing ladders and stairs and heavy lifting.

Some exposure to unpleasant odors in the work area as well as contaminated items and strong cleaning solutions.

Some hazards from improperly disposed needles and glass.

Exposure to all types of weather conditions.

Hazards are minimized with adherence to established safety precautions.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY:
None

doc.title: APD Specialist
doc.description:
We are Farmers!

We are… more than just your favorite commercials. We are a passionate, award winning, equal opportunity employer, committed to the strength of a diverse workforce. We are dedicated to supporting the well-being of our people through our extensive suite of benefits, as well as the well-being of the communities we serve through employee volunteer programs and nonprofit partnerships. Helping others in their time of need isn’t just our business – it’s our culture! We are Farmers!

Do you thrive in a high-volume, fast-paced environment? Do you enjoy the challenge of a position where no two days are alike? We are looking for positive, high-energy professionals who are not just looking for a job, but a meaningful career!

Job Summary

APD Specialist who either completes in-person or virtual inspections and prepares estimates, or proactively reviews and adjusts estimates from repair shops, either Direct Repair or non-Direct repair, and subrogation demands from other carriers. Establishes damages and negotiates settlement of claims with repair facilities and/or customers and works with them to manage repairs and rental. Reviews and resolves supplements. Confirms accuracy of Total Loss evaluations and negotiates settlement with customers or their representative. Communicates and collaborates with Claim Owners to facilitate claim resolution for customers.

Essential Job Functions

Completes vehicle inspections and prepares estimate or reviews and adjusts estimates from repair facilities and subrogation demands using claims estimating software and determines claims related damage. Establishes damages and negotiates settlement of claims with repair facilities or other carriers. Manages repair process and adjusts auto repair supplements and manages rental. Confirms accuracy of total loss evaluation, explains the process and settles total loss claims when appropriate. Obtains total loss salvage release from policyholder or claimant and completes field clearing note before assigning to Salvage department, mitigating additional salvage storage costs. Interacts/collaborates directly with policyholders, claimants, agents, and other representatives including repair facilities. Explains damages and the repair process, and sets expectations. Effectively collaborates with claim owners for customer interaction and resolution strategy. Appropriate communication with all entities associated with the claim to ensure the repairs are completed efficiently. This includes parts availability and appropriate repair scheduling. Confirms, explains, and applies coverage, assists with rental management, determines and reports on subrogation potential, fraud ind icators, negotiates and issues claim payments. Performs applicable administrative tasks (timekeeping, expense reports). Completes assigned training and activities to develop the knowledge, skills and abilities required to complete the job duties. Performs other duties as assigned

Physical Actions

Sits or stands for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Occasionally reaches overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Occasionally moves, lifts, carries, and places objects and supplies weighing 0-10 pounds without assistance. Listens to, interprets, and differentiates auditory information (e.g. others speaking) at normal speaking levels with or without correction. Visually verifies and reads information. Visually locates material, resources and other objects. Ability to continuously operate a computer for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Physical dexterity sufficient to use hands, arms, and shoulders repetitively to operate keyboard and other office equipment up to a full work shift.

Physical Environment

Required job duties are normally performed in a climate-controlled office environment, but with exposure to some or all of the following environments when in the field: Uncontrolled outside environmental conditions Excessive Noise Levels Chemicals Chemical/Biological Conditions Moving Mechanical Parts Areas considered to be dangerous Conditions, which could affect the respiratory system or skin such as: fumes, odors, dust, mists, gases, oils, smoke, soot, or poor ventilation

Education Requirements

High School diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's degree preferred.

Experience Requirements

Basic negotiating skills. Basic interpersonal and communication skills. Basic computer skills. Automotive repair knowledge preferred. Basic conflict resolution skills. Basic critical thinking skills. Actively pursuing I-CAR Platinum designation and technical learning & 3-5 years of estimating experience preferred.

Benefits

  • Farmers offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience, qualifications and location.

o CA Only: $27.42 - $39.66

  • Bonus Opportunity (based on Company and Individual Performance)
  • 401(k)
  • Medical

  • Life Insurance

doc.title: Front Desk Intake Eligibility Specialist
doc.description:
The primary mission of Energy Services is to provide limited income families with the services and assistance necessary to prevent and or alleviate energy-related emergencies from occurring, while promoting initiatives that result in a family’s long-term self-sufficiency.

Energy Services is seeking qualified applicants for a Front Desk / Intake Eligibility Specialist position for our offices located in Waupaca, WI. This position is full time and will serve all communities within Wisconsin. Must have a passion and outgoing personality for working with limited and low income households, excellent customer service, math and computer skills. This very rewarding position is a combination of processing applications either in person with the customer or over the phone to establish the eligibility for energy assistance, collaborating with other agencies and stakeholders within the community, attending community events to serve the low income population of the counties listed above, specifically veterans, disabled, elderly and families with young children. The role would require greeting clients in person and via phone in both a front desk capacity and in a face to face setting. Experience working in a non-profit setting with limited income families, elderly and veterans a plus. Hours are Monday - Friday 8:30 - 5:00 but we work until 6:00 on Tuesdays and Thursdays during the winter season.

doc.title: Registered Behavior Technician (RBT) - Hermosa
doc.description:
Please Join us Wednesday May 17th 8:00 am - 10:00 am for our Virtual Job Fair!

Please use the link below to access the job fair.

https://us02web.zoom.us/j/7667222681

People Philosophy: We are committed to fostering a culture of diversity, equity, inclusion and belonging, by creating awareness through education, community outreach and building companywide DEIB ownership. We are The Place for All, where our employees are supported, informed, valued, trusted and empowered. The Place is an environment where both employees and clients can thrive.

Our Mission: The Place for Children with Autism provides evidence-based, high quality, and compassionate therapy across all communities - changing lives one child, one family at a time.

Our Values:

  • Service-focused Leadership
  • Purpose-driven Team & Community
  • Continuous Learning
  • Quality & Excellence
  • Joy, Fun, & Celebration

Are you looking for a place to work that provides established processes in which you can learn with training and practice? Do you enjoy a team where people are passionate about what they do and care about one another? While you like to think about your co-workers as a type of “family”, you appreciate a fun work environment, while you also pay close attention to procedures and quality.

Is this you? Then we need you as our Registered Behavior Technician.

What you can expect:

  • Purpose-driven, sometimes hard and rewarding work
  • Monday - Friday between 7:45 am and 4:45 pm schedule
  • 40-hour guarantee (pay stability) for client cancellations
  • One-on-one morning and afternoon sessions providing individualized ABA therapy to each assigned client (ages 2-6). Behavior therapists are typically assigned 2 clients
  • Deliver early intervention therapy in a center-based, supportive environment
  • Carry out individualized plans for each child by implementing programs and behavior intervention plans designed by your BCBA Supervisor
  • Ensure the safety of all clients by following established protocols and procedures, including safety regulations
  • Be a part of a passionate team of therapist’s and continue to expand knowledge through training, mentorship, and staff development meetings

What we need from you:

  • Passionate about making a difference for children with autism spectrum disorder and their families
  • A sense of dedication to “be present” every day while working with both clients and your fellow team members
  • Be reliable and dependable – your clients and your team members will be counting on you
  • Detailed oriented with a strong focus on quality
  • A willingness to continuously learn and open to constructive feedback for development
  • Physical aspects of the position require:
  • Lifting of up to 20 pounds
  • Bending and squatting for up to an hour per day
  • Kids are fast, so the ability to follow a child without restrictions throughout the center (sometimes at a rapid pace) is needed
  • High School Diploma or equivalent

What we offer:

  • A full-time position
  • Competitive Pay ($17/hr - $23/hr based on experience)
  • Quarterly Quality Bonus eligibility
  • Medical, dental, vision, disability, commuter benefits, and EAP
  • We support our current and soon to be parents by offering Paid Parental Leave
  • 401(k) with company match up to 3%
  • Up to 29 days off per year including vacation, sick, personal wellness time and paid holidays
  • $25 monthly health/wellness membership reimbursement
  • Job progression program
  • Education and empowerment are valued at The Place, therefore, we cover the first RBT Exam and renewal fee’s and provide educational reimbursement for approved programs
  • Program specific tuition discount through partnership colleges and universities
  • Fun work environment
  • Appreciation and Spirit Days

The Place for Children with Autism is an Equal Opportunity Employer, all qualified applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

doc.title: Registration Specialist
doc.description:
JOIN THE BEST TEAM ON THE FIELD IN SPORT, SPIRIT & ACHIEVEMENT
At Varsity Brands, we believe every student deserves the opportunity to succeed and every educator wants to make a difference. It takes a team to make a real impact, and through our three distinct brands – BSN SPORTS, Varsity Spirit and Herff Jones – and our network of 9,000+ employees and independent representatives, we are proud to partner with schools, colleges and universities across the country to transform the student journey in SPORT, SPIRIT and ACHIEVEMENT.

Are you looking to play an important role on a winning team? Are you looking for more than “just a job,” but a place where you can truly thrive and have your daily contributions make a real difference in someone’s life? At Varsity Brands we’re a growing company where you can lend your skills and talents in support of a greater mission. In return, you get to work with great people on challenging assignments that will accelerate your professional growth.

Your Opportunity:
Varsity Spirit is looking for a Registration Specialist to join our team in Louisville, KY.
Make an Impact:
The Registration Specialist is important member of our Varsity All Star Registration team, ultimately responsible for ensuring that their customers have a seamless event registration experience.
A Day in the Life:
  • Answer phones and assists with customer questions; provide excellent customer service
  • Update and maintain Salesforce pricing and divisions for events within region
  • Receive, input, update as needed and monitor individual event registration
  • Create and help manage wait lists for events within the region
  • Help with overflow registration with End of Season events as needed
  • Update and Maintain events in the USASF website
  • Training on-site registration personnel
  • Have knowledge and full understanding of:
    • Release Waivers (or no release waivers)
    • Rules and Regulations
    • Terms and Conditions
    • Music Verification
    • Policies and Procedures
    • USASF Compliance and Waivers
    • Bid Declarations/Intentions
    • Rec Verification
  • Collect all money before or on-site and applicable forms for assigned events
  • Event Closeout
    • Zero out event (credits and balances)
    • USASF event closeout
    • Replenish Registration Materials
    • Process/Deliver Checks and or Cash for Deposits
    • Organize and store all registration forms from event
  • Work with Event Coordinator, Scoring Department, USASF and other departments to ensure the best event experience for the customer and to maintain compliance with requirements
  • Pack & organize all registration materials for truck traveling to event
  • Monitor and provide frequent updates on regional event participation
  • Monitor and participate in BAND app Q&A
  • Manage the goals and success metrics established
  • Work closely with Regional Director of Operational Excellence, Director of All Star Experience, and Customer Experience Manager
  • Work as program’s point of contact on site at assigned events
