  • Participate on various committees and/or boards essential to our business both indirectly and directly

What you bring to the table:

doc.title: Support Worker
doc.description:
Here at Heart of England Mencap we enable people with learning disabilities to lead fulfilling lives allowing them to thrive and do, be and feel their best! We know that we can only achieve this by hiring the best staff who share our values.

We are looking for Support Workers to join our team based within our Respite and Residential homes in Stratford Upon Avon. Our residential property is the home of 2 lovely residents who have Learning Disabilities and require some support with daily living tasks. Our customers enjoy a range of hobbies and activities ranging from gardening, horse riding, arts and crafts, dancing and are all fond of going out for meals at the local pub.

Our thriving respite home offers a 'home from home' environment for customers. Our ethos is to encourage independence and social relationships. Respite can often be our customers first experience away from home so it's a great opportunity to learn new skills and develop their skills in a safe and supported way. We encourage our customers to access the community and we are looking for new team members to share this passion.

Within both properties, our sleep in shifts typically start from around 3pm where you may spend some time supporting our customers with their afternoon and evening routine. You might be required to prepare meals with our customers or maybe just some encouragement and support for them to do so themselves, it could also include assisting with grooming/personal care and washing/dressing. Our sleep ins are paid competitively at £70.47 per sleep in (between 11pm - 7am). A typical morning could then include helping our customers to get up, dressed and prepared for the day before finishing your shift at around 10am.
Our day shift patterns within this service include: 8am - 3pm or 3pm - 9pm during the week and 10am - 6pm on weekends.

Some previous care experience is preferred however full training will be provided - after all, good care comes from the HEART.

*
Alongside being part of something amazing, our employee benefits include:*
Extensive training and development – we will support with health and social care diplomas together with the care certificate
28 days’ annual leave (inclusive of bank holidays) rising to 33 days after 5 years
Access to 24 hour Employee Assistance Scheme and trained mental health first aiders
Discount card for high street and online retailers
Employee ‘Refer a Friend’ scheme
Long service awards
Sick pay
Life assurance scheme
Staff recognition awards

If you want to really make a difference every day and share our values: Honest Effective Aspirational Respectful Trustworthy why not apply today!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £10.50 per hour

What will you do?

  • Maintain system security through permission-based configuration to uphold the organisation’s IT security policies.
  • Drive developments by mapping business requirements into user stories, consider cost benefit analysis and influencing improvements within the provider’s development road map and business change plan.
  • Provide project management, user testing and business acceptance through to end user training (workshops and user guides) to deploy system features to the business.
  • Provide data management, ensuring data configuration is organised and protected under GDPR principles, limited to purpose with controls to remain compliant and retention and archiving strategies deployed.
  • Support business growth with system expertise and helpdesk support to ensure new business initiatives, clients and sites are set up as per mobilisation and project planning.


What we are looking for?

  • System Support Helpdesk Management experience
  • Experience in system development, user story creation and testing and deployment using tools such as Jira.
  • Design and management of customer facing portals and apps.
  • Prioritisation of workload in a high demand role, with ability to break down and estimate task workload.
  • Business Reporting Management – able to gather business requirements, set up and manage data into KPI reports.
  • Project Management skills to deploy new system features directly to the business.
  • Change Management Experience


Desirable

  • Knowledge of Residential Management Software - Yardi, MRI PM, Fix Flo and residential apps such as Spike Global and Padoq.
  • Knowledge of Hubspot
  • Database Qualifications – trained in Power BI, MS SQL or similar.
  • Project / Change Management (Prince, AGILE)

doc.title: Security Officer
doc.description:
Security Officer
Location: Hemel Hampstead
Salary: £11.00 per hour (during probation) £11.50 per hour there onwards
Shift Patterns: 56 Hours per week
Shift Timings: from 07:00 to 19:00/from 19:00 to 07:00
Shift Pattern: 3 Days, 3 Night & 3 off
Job reference: 507
Closing date: 22/05/2023

Do you have the passion to work in a career that offers flexibility, the skillset to deliver excellent safety and customer service in one of our established and distinguished sites in London? If so, this could be the perfect role for you.

Who we are
We are GUK, and together we are proud to be at the forefront of protection management across multiple sectors. We offer the ultimate in business security solutions and deliver the highest quality of professional service.

Job Role
Working with us at GUK, we value you more than just a security guard. You will be responsible for providing safety to the public with Patrols, creating access passes and using your experience of who can gain access. Your flexibility and experience will create a rapport with our high end clients to deliver excellence.
The role is critical to ensure our operational day-to-day frontline services work like clockwork. A typical day for someone who is self-motivated could include access control, greeting visitors, regular patrols, and completing the daily occurrence book. You will then finish every shift with a good thorough handover.
You are an individual who communicates well, have a strong sense for reliability and understand the importance of being smartly always presented in uniform. Also, you would need to be proactive and always willing to learn.
You will receive full training and we are looking for motivated individuals who will make a measurable contribution to the continued success of GUK.

Ideal Experience
  • Proof of right to work
  • Valid SIA licence
  • 5 Year employment history
  • Experience of composing emails and preparing incident reports
  • Proactively uses initiative to recognise priorities within own workload
  • Problem solving
  • First Aid at Work
  • Minimum 1 years security experience
  • Minimum 1 years Front of House experience


Ideally you will have developed these Skills:
  • Customer services
  • Able to communicate in English at a good level, both written and oral communication
  • Basic report writing and IT skills
  • Dealing with difficult people
  • Team work
  • Challenging the status quo
  • Self-motivated

Employee Benefits

GUK pride ourselves in offering benefits that promote health and wellbeing.

  • Ride to Work Scheme
  • Employee Assistance Program

GUK / RUK is an equal opportunities employer, we encourage applications from a diverse range of individuals. We believe that a diverse talented workforce nurtures excellence and makes us a great place to work, where individuality and inclusivity are celebrated.

We reserve the order to stop taking applications when we have had a suitable amount of response.

doc.title: Food Packer
doc.description:
PACKER
Job Overview

Gate Gourmet is the world's largest independent provider of catering services for airlines and is the core business behind gategroup, whose eleven associated brands offer customers a comprehensive scope of products and services for virtually any on-board need. We provide more than 200 million meals a year to our 270-plus customers at some 120 airport locations around the globe.If you are would like to be part of a friendly and exciting team, working a regular shift of 4 on 4 off, we would love to hear from you. Free transport shuttle bus from/ to City Place Bus Stop, Beehive Road, RH6 0PA, to coincide with shifts start/finish times.

What will life as a Packer in the gategroup Team look like for you.

  • Inhouse training and development

doc.title: IT Support Technician

doc.title: Graduate Civil Infrastructure (2023) - Hale, Manchester
doc.city: Hale, Hampshire, South East England, England
doc.description:
Key Info


  • Location: Hale, Manchester
  • Anticipated start: September 2023
  • Deadline for applications: Friday 26 May 2023


We are not able to provide a Skilled Worker visa for this position. You will need to be eligible to work in the UK without our sponsorship to be considered for this role. Please do not apply if you have limited leave to enter or remain in the UK e.g. a visitor visa, a student/graduate visa or an employer-sponsored visa from a previous employer.


Looking to kickstart your career or wanting a career change?


Here’s a fantastic opportunity to join our progressive, award-winning Civil and Structural Engineering team delivering sustainable projects for our communities, planet and society.


We are looking for graduates with a passion for the built environment, and the desire to work in a highly collaborative multi-disciplinary team focused on sustainability, technical excellence and shaping construction in the UK and overseas.


You will be developing your technical skills through taking on a variety of complex projects as well as being supported in the development of your softer skills through our early careers learning and development program: ‘The Learning Curve’.


What will you learn with us


  • Scheme development, preliminary and detailed designs and project coordination
  • Upholding the quality and accuracy of deliverables
  • Design and site meetings, site inspections and progress reporting
  • Leading projects including budgetary control
  • Preparing fee proposals
  • Mentoring junior colleagues


What you will need to succeed?


  • A relevant qualification in civil engineering and several years consultancy experience
  • Working knowledge of Section 104, 278 and 38 adoption procedures
  • Experience of working with developers
  • Working knowledge of relevant software such as AutoCAD, Microdrainage, Civil 3D, AutoTrack and Drawnet or similar packages
  • Understanding of UK planning procedures and experience of providing technical support to secure planning approval
  • Experience of securing technical approvals from highway and drainage authorities
  • Self-motivated team player with good people skills
  • Integrity and credibility. People want to work with you (customers and colleagues)
  • Believes in our ethos


We are also keen to know if you can offer any of these attributes


  • Sustainable urban drainage, biodiversity net gain, flood risk and nutrient neutrality knowledge, or an interest in these fields
  • Digital engineering skills, including coding experience related to design automation or other digitisation improvements.
  • Additional languages that you are fluent or able to apply professionally, as well as English
  • Full UK Driving Licence
  • Student or Graduate Membership with the ICE and/or IStructE


What's great about Hydrock 'in a nutshell'


We are a British-owned integrated multi-disciplinary engineering consultancy of over 900 staff in 21 offices across the UK. Our driving motivation is to be a ‘force for good’, as it is our aim to positively contribute to people’s lives including our employees, communities we work in, clients we work with and our planet as a whole.


From the buildings that surround you, the roads and bridges you cross, all related to the infrastructure that we create, we aim to offer the most sustainable possibilities to shape the places, communities and society that we live in through meeting our client’s needs. Through the path we are on to delivering a green future, the result is something that everyone can be proud of.


Our welcoming and friendly culture is something we are proud of and has gained us recognition with 9 years in the Top 100 Best Companies to Work For list. One of our incredible sustainable projects include regenerating a brownfield site to a residential development at Castle Park View. Other notable projects include UWE’s Faculty of Engineering and Design making two wins at the British Construction Industry Award in 2021 and UK Hydrographic Office Taunton winning multiple awards in the same year!


To top off, here’s our 2022 wrap up video!


What we can offer


  • Inspiring and supportive colleagues
  • Reward for progression and hard work
  • An opportunity to develop your soft skills on “The Learning Curve” program
  • Competitive starting salary
  • Excellent health benefits
  • 25 days of holiday (buy/sell up to five days)
  • An earlier finish on Friday (4pm!)
  • An opportunity to give back: “Day off for good cause” (on a workday)
  • A huge range of flexible benefits
  • Our biggest event of the year: Annual Challenge Day!


A place to feel included


We champion diversity, equity and inclusion. As an Equal Opportunities Employer, we commit to supporting our employees and ensure we create a safe environment that nurtures you to perform at your best. Offering our people flexibility is an important factor in achieving this aim!


We consider all applications individually with the required qualifications and knowledge without regard to any of the protected characteristics. We would like to provide everyone with a fair selection, assessment and employment experience so we ask that we are made aware of any physical or neurodiverse condition within your application, for which appropriate reasonable adjustments can be made by us.


Looking for the next steps?


  • Once you have completed your application through our careers site, we will be in touch with you as soon as we’ve considered your application alongside others for this role.
  • Typically, this can take several weeks so if you haven't heard back from us, not to worry, your application is still actively being considered!
  • With the high volume of applications, we are unable to provide ad hoc updates on the progress of applications. However, we will contact you when decisions have been made.


For the latest updates and news, connect with us on our LinkedIn page!

doc.title: Support Worker
doc.description:
*New starter bonus of £750 for new employees within this service!*

We are looking for 2 Support Workers to join our brilliant team at our Valley Road short breaks service.
We have an opening for a 28 hour a week contract or a 35-40 hour a week contract, both on a permanent basis.

Valley Road is a 4 bed home offering customers a home away from home experience. Our customers range from 18 years old through to their mid 50’s with their stays ranging from 1 night to 2 weeks and can include a variety of activities including cooking and baking, sensory sessions, access to our large garden with our adapted adult swing, basketball, football, access to the local community which may be going out to pubs, cafes, cinema, parks, movie nights and pamper sessions.

In the week, our shifts tend to be 7.30am-10am where you may spend some time supporting our customers with their morning routine. You might be required to prepare meals with our customers or maybe just some encouragement and support for them to do so themselves, it could also include assisting with grooming/personal care and washing/dressing ready to start their day. Some of our customers may go to a day service or to college for the day, whilst others will stay in the home so the option of 7.30am – 3pm shifts may become available in line with our customers wishes. We also have a 3pm-10pm shift once our customers have returned from their day activities. On the weekends, our shifts patterns are 7.30am–3pm or 3pm-10pm and will include activities and going out into the community – we are supportive of our customers going out into the community, developing new friendships and doing their favourite things so for our team no Two days are the same!

Some previous care experience could be advantageous however full training will be provided - after all, good care comes from the HEART.

Alongside being part of something amazing, our employee benefits include:

Extensive training and development – we will support with health and social care diplomas together with the care certificate
28 days’ annual leave (inclusive of bank holidays) rising to 33 days after 5 years
Access to 24 hour Employee Assistance Scheme and trained mental health first aiders
Discount card for high street and online retailers
Employee ‘Refer a Friend’ scheme
Long service awards
Sick pay
Life assurance scheme
Staff recognition awards
+ Plus! Our New Starter incentive - earn an additional £750 in your first payslip for joining us!

If you want to really make a difference every day and share our values: Honest Effective Aspirational Respectful Trustworthy why not apply today!

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: £10.50 per hour

doc.title: CNC Programmer / Setter / Operator (Turning)
doc.description:
CNC Programmer / Setter / Operator (Turning)


Precision Components Ltd is a leading manufacturing of compressor rotor screws based in Rochdale. We specialise in the manufacture of high-quality precision engineered helical components for various industries. We are committed to utilising advanced technology and maintaining the highest standards in our manufacturing processes.


As part of our growth and expansion, we are currently seeking a time-served CNC Machine Programmer Setter Turner to join our dynamic team. Critical to this role is the use of FANUC controls.


Job Purpose


Part of a multi-skilled, friendly engineering team, you will programme, set, and operate CNC Turning machines producing precision components to a high specification and rigorous quality standard.


Responsibilities:

  • Set up and operate CNC turning machines specifically Doosan LY - knowledge of MoriSeiki, SwedTurn & manual machines would be an advantage.
  • Programme CNC machines using FANUC controls.
  • Interpret technical drawings and job orders to determine machine setup requirements.
  • Select and install appropriate cutting tools, attachments, and fixtures for each job.
  • Conduct quality control inspections to ensure parts meet specification using conventional measurement techniques, diagnose errors and correct any deviation.
  • Monitor machine operations, making necessary adjustments and troubleshooting issues as they arise.
  • Perform routine maintenance and cleaning of machines to ensure optimal performance.
  • Collaborate with team members and supervisors to optimise production processes.
  • Adhere to safety guidelines and maintain a clean and organized work environment.
  • Train other operators when required and mentor apprentices.


Requirements:

  • Proven time served CNC operator, Turner, with machine set-up and FANUC control programming experience.
  • Experience of producing complex components to very tight tolerances.
  • Experience of operating a range of Turning machines (Doosan LY, MoriSeiki, SwedTurn) and manual machines.
  • Work efficiently and accurately with minimum supervision.
  • Keen to learn other machine operations with training.
  • Flexible and can work a rotating shift pattern.
  • Willingness to work overtime when required.
  • Knowledge of metal cutting techniques and Lean principles.
  • Qualified Advanced Modern Apprenticeship or recognised time-served certification.
  • Other relevant training an advantage: FLT, health & safety, manual handling, Lean, 5 S, etc.


Salary & Benefits:

Competitive salary, premium overtime rates - overtime available

Two-week rotating shift pattern, 38:20 hr week – early finish on a Friday:

Week 1: Mon to Thur: 5:45 till 14:10, Fri: 5:45-11:45. Week 2: 14:10 till 22:15, Fri: 11:45 till 19:25


Benefits: Pension 6% employer matched, Life Assurance 4xbasic, 33 holidays p.a. increasing to 38 with service, Employee Assistance Programme, Company Sick Pay Scheme, Service Recognition Scheme, Performance Recognition & Reward Scheme, Cash Heath Plan, Gift at Christmas.

doc.title: Operations en customer service agent Telematics
doc.description:
Ben jij die teamspeler die ervoor zorgt dat je collega’s volledig ontzorgd worden?

Sta jij stevig in je schoenen en beschik je over sterke communicatieve vaardigheden?

Houd je van een dynamische werkomgeving en verlies je de klanttevredenheid niet uit het oog?


Voor ons kantoor in Breda zijn wij op zoek naar een


Operations en customer service agent Telematics / Kinesis


Wat is Kinesis?

Kinesis is onze fleet management service. Kinesis maakt gebruik van satelliettechnologie om

rechtstreeks te communiceren met de motormanagementsystemen van de voertuigen van onze

klanten. Kinesis toont live de locaties van de voertuigen, de reisgeschiedenis en laat precies zien hoe

de voertuigen van de klant worden bestuurd om hun wagenpark te helpen beheren.


Hoe zien jouw werkzaamheden eruit?

  • Je bent het eerste aanspreekpunt voor alle klantvragen
  • Je hebt dagelijks contact met installatiepartners
  • Je beheert de Agent Service Desk met inachtneming van alle service level overeenkomsten
  • Je onderhoudt dagelijks contact met niet geactiveerde klanten
  • Je hebt wekelijkse onderhoudsgesprekken met bestaande klanten


Hier herken jij jezelf in

  • Je hebt een MBO+ werk- en denkniveau
  • Je bent communicatief en administratief vaardig met een commerciële twist
  • Je bent oplossings- en resultaatgericht en kan snel schakelen tussen verschillende taken
  • Beheersing van MS Office, met name gevorderd in Excel
  • Je hebt minstens 1 jaar ervaring in een soortgelijke rol met veel telefonisch contact
  • Affiniteit met techniek en transport is een pré


Wat bieden wij jou?

Bij Radius kan je jezelf zijn en krijg je de ruimte om jezelf te ontplooien en te ontwikkelen:

  • Een doorlopend (intern) zakelijk en persoonlijk ontwikkel- en trainingsprogramma
  • Doorgroeimogelijkheden in een internationale organisatie
  • Een leuke werksfeer en samenwerking met een enthousiast, gemotiveerd en divers team
  • Salaris op basis van opleiding, kennis en ervaring vanaf € 2.450
  • Een individuele bonusregeling, de eerste drie maanden gegarandeerd uitbetaald
  • 25 Verlofdagen en na elke 2,5 jaar dienstverband 1 extra verlofdag
  • Pensioen- en nabestaandenverzekering
  • Leuke incentives en teamactiviteiten
  • Een informele organisatiecultuur; work hard, play hard
  • Wekelijks vers fruit voor een extra energie boost
  • Een prachtig dakterras, uitermate geschikt voor een gezellige vrijdagmiddag borrel


Wil jij werken bij een bedrijf dat er écht toe doet?

Radius Business Solutions (Nederland) B.V. is één van de snelst groeiende aanbieders van vlootbeheer tools in Nederland. Vanuit Breda werken wij met een team van zo’n 35 collega’s aan een sterke groei en naamsbekendheid van onze producten. Door ons uitgebreide pakket van tankkaarten, laadpassen, laadpalen, telematica systemen en aanvullende diensten voor mobiliteit zijn wij in staat om ieder bedrijf een passende oplossing te bieden. Radius Business Solutions (Nederland) B.V. maakt onderdeel uit van Radius Payment Solutions Ltd., één van de toonaangevende bedrijven wereldwijd op het gebied van vlootbeheer.

doc.company_name: Newlife the Charity for Disabled Children
doc.title: Communications Manager
doc.description:
Communications Manager

Location: Cannock Staffordshire / hybrid
Contract Type: Permanent
Salary: Circa £35k per annum depending on skills and experience
Hours: Full Time 37.5 hours per week, Flexi Policy in place

At Newlife, our mission, simply put, is to change the lives of disabled children and their families. We provide access to the vital equipment they rely on, offer information and support through our team of dedicated healthcare professionals, sponsor pioneering medical research into the causes of birth defects and offer families a voice through our campaigns for change.

Our mission, simply put, is to change lives and you could be a part of that change!

The role
We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced communications professional to join our growing team at Newlife as our Communications Manager. As well as experience in a similar role, you will have:
  • Proven strategic skills, the ability to plan and develop content and messaging as well as measure outputs from communications campaigns.
  • You will have editorial responsibility for key communication outputs including annual reports, Child & Family service publications, fundraising marketing materials and blogs for web, to name just a few. You will be able to flex your writing style depending on the audience and be able to write for impact.
  • You will have developed internal and external communications plans in your previous roles and managed projects (including budgets) from conception to completion, working collaboratively with a range of stakeholders.
  • Previous people management experience is essential for this role as is working with stakeholders and managing agencies/freelancers.
  • You will be able to thrive in a fast-paced environment and excel at handling multiple concurrent projects and must be able to understand how to measure the effectiveness of communications efforts and provide reports.
  • You will be highly creative and demonstrate an affinity to the charity and its mission.

To apply please submit your CV and covering letter outlining how your skills and experience meet those of the role requirements.

doc.title: Line Cook (nights)
doc.description:
Food Coordinator


Job Summary:

As a Food Coordinator, you will work from our Gategroup Gatwick Unit as an important member of the team and support the team of Commis Chefs and Chef de Parties in the preparation and cooking of delicious in-flight meals as well as preparing and conduction Customer Presentations as required. Working to tight timelines, you will communicate effectively with the kitchen staff to ensure meals are prepared to exact specifications and quantities and that the work area is kept safe and as clean as possible while maintaining high standards of quality, hygiene, and health and safety at all times.


What will life as a Line Cook in the gategroup Team look like for you.

  • £13.20 per hour + over time benefits
  • 4 on 4 off shift pattern
  • Inhouse training and development
  • Complimentary meals & beverages
  • Free Uniform
  • Company sick pay
  • Free on-site parking
  • Paid Holiday
  • Rotating shifts patterns
  • Pension scheme to help you save for your future since day one
  • Bespoke employee support programmer, including free counselling sessions
  • Refer a friend scheme with generous bonuses for each successful referral
  • Access to a great discount platform, saving you money on everyday purchases and so much more
  • Cycle to work


Main Duties and Responsibilities

  • Experience working under pressure and in a high-volume kitchen, preferably experienced in fresh food.
  • Competent understanding of all regulations, food hygiene and company specifications.
  • A genuine passion for delivering top quality dishes
  • An excellent team player with exceptional communication skills
  • Reads and interprets recipes whilst seeking guidance from Chefs as required
  • Packing and labelling of hot meals ready to serve
  • Adheres to HACCP and regional safety regulations in compliance with gategroup policies and procedures.
  • Responsible for safe and clean workstation and equipment always.
  • Controls food compliance and quality - understanding of kitchen disciplines and food safety (training given)
  • Use of company technology (iPads and printers for food labels)

doc.title: Spülkraft / Küchenhilfe (m/w/d)
doc.description:
Standort: Tornesch, vom: 05.06.2023
Teilzeit 30 Stunden vormittags // befristet auf 24 Monate
medac ist ein zukunftsgerichtetes, seit über fünfzig Jahren dynamisch wachsendes Unternehmen. Über 2.000 Mitarbeiter kümmern sich um die Neu- und Weiterentwicklung von Arzneimitteln und Medizinprodukten für die Diagnostik und Behandlung onkologischer, urologischer und Autoimmunerkrankungen. Insbesondere bei Nischenprodukten zählen wir zu den führenden Pharmaunternehmen.

In unserem Betriebsrestaurant in Tornesch sorgen wir von Montag bis Freitag dafür, dass alle Mitarbeiter*innen vom Frühstück, über gesunde Snacks bis zum Mittagessen gut versorgt werden. Sie unterstützen das Team durch folgende Tätigkeiten:


  • Vorbereitungen & Produktion des Frühstücksangebotes
  • Bedienung der Spülmaschine und leichte Reinigungstätigkeiten im Küchenbereich
  • Unterstützung bei der Produktion der Speisen
  • Allgemeine Küchentätigkeiten
  • Gute Kenntnisse in der deutschen Sprache
  • Sorgfältiges und hygienisches Arbeiten mit Lebensmitteln
  • Gepflegtes Äußeres
  • Teamfähigkeit und Freundlichkeit
  • 30 Urlaubstage im Jahr und Urlaubsgeld
  • Unternehmensweite erfolgsbasierte Prämienzahlungen
  • Attraktive Sozialleistungen, wie Unfallversicherung, betriebliche Altersvorsorge, vermögenswirksame Leistungen, externe Mitarbeiterberatung und Betreuungsangebote für Kinder
  • Diverse Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten über die medac Akademie
  • Vielseitige Aktivitäten und Aktionen zu Sport und Gesundheit
  • Betriebsrestaurants vor Ort mit abwechslungsreicher gesunder Küche aus regionalen Produkten
  • Zuschuss zum Deutschland-Ticket
Wenn Sie eine neue berufliche Herausforderung und eine zukunftsorientierte Aufgabe suchen, freuen wir uns auf Ihre Online-Bewerbung mit Angabe Ihres frühestmöglichen Eintrittstermins und Ihrer Gehaltsvorstellung. Hierfür steht Ihnen unser Online-Bewerbungsformular auf medac.de zur Verfügung. Bitte beachten Sie, dass Bewerbungsunterlagen nicht zurückgeschickt werden können.

doc.description:
WJCS is hiring! If working alongside a team of caring professionals interests you, apply now!

Details about this exciting opportunity:

  • Full-Time Clinician opening in our Developmental Disabilities program based out of our Hartsdale Mental Health Clinic.
  • This role will provide services to individuals in the community who have a psychiatric diagnosis as well as autism and/or cognitive challenges.
  • We seek Clinicians with a particular interest, and/or experience, in working with children and adults who also have developmental disabilities or autism.
  • Compensation: $55,000 - $70,000/year.

What WJCS has to offer you:

  • Sign-On Bonus.
  • Generous PTO, Comprehensive Health Benefits and a Healthcare Reimbursement Arrangement (HRA).
  • 403(b) Plan and an Agency-Paid Pension Plan.
  • Opportunity for Professional Growth through the WJCS Educational Institute.
  • Employee Assistance and Referral Program.

Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):

  • Providing direct service in various evidence and promising practice therapeutic modalities on an individual, couples, and group basis meeting agency productivity expectations.
  • Outreach and connection with patient related contacts, other agencies and resources (physicians, case managers, schools, etc.) associated with clients. All client contact is recorded in an electronic chart.
  • Supervising other staff or students, when applicable.

If you have the following:

Qualifications:

  • An MSW and License to practice Social Work in the State of New York.
  • LMHC’s are also encouraged to apply.

  • Bi-lingual, English/Spanish is preferred.

And Attributes:

  • Comfort with computer applications is helpful.

Then we are excited to receive your application!

Why join Westchester Jewish Community Services (WJCS)?

Founded in 1943, WJCS provides a vast range of supportive community services each year to 20,000 people of all ages and backgrounds. Across every division, WJCS employees are connected by their shared values and commitment to helping those in need.

We are dedicated to ensuring dignity and respect for all employees in an inclusive and safe environment that values diversity, experience, and merit. We are committed to racial justice and equal opportunity, regardless of race, religion, ethnicity, class, ability, sexual orientation, and gender identity differences—for employment, professional development, and advancement for qualified individuals.

doc.description:

Regular

20
Come work at a place where innovation and teamwork come together to support the most exciting missions in the world!
Position Summary:
Fill-in, part-time position for Casual Nutrition Site Manager
Wisconsin Rapids: Employee will work 9:30 a.m.- 1:30 a.m. (Monday-Friday).
The Casual Nutrition Site Manager provides oversight and serves meals at the dining site and/or packages Meals on Wheels. Employee will work as needed to fill in for sick leave, vacation, when more assistance is needed, etc.
Qualifications:
High school graduation or equivalent. Experience in food service is desirable. Serving Safe Food Training will be provided. Must have a driver's license and a driving record that meets County standards.
Examples of Work Performed:
The following duties are normal for this position. These are not to be construed as exclusive or all-inclusive. Other duties may be required and assigned.
  • Maintains daily operations, cleanliness, and standards for food safety for nutrition program services.
  • Assures food and meal temperatures are maintained according to safe food handling standards. Maintains temperature logs for food and holding equipment. Completes temperature testing procedures to assure food safety.
  • Follows proper food safety and sanitation procedures including appropriate handwashing and calibrating thermometers. Reads menus to determine appropriate serving utensils and appropriate foods for specialized diets; monitors quality and quantity of food.
  • Oversees volunteers.
  • Prepares accurate participant service documents and other data as part of the reporting requirements of the nutrition program. Verifies customer eligibility for service based on customer registration form details.
  • Encourages socialization of senior dining customers.
  • Works closely with the Nutrition Program leadership staff and other partners as appropriate to recommend new or improved models for service improvements.
  • Communicates daily with clerical services team regarding meal and supply orders, and for customer follow-up with unserved/undelivered meals.
  • Alerts supervisor to changes in service, problems, unusual circumstances, and/or areas needing improvement.
  • Uses dish machine to wash dishes.
  • Greets customers and takes meal reservations.
  • Responsible for locked contribution box being delivered to ADRC-CW office at the end of shift.
  • Maintains regular and predictable attendance.
  • Uses basic technology tools including email.
  • Performs related work as required.
Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:
  • Ability to lift 40 pounds and transport with use of a cart.
  • Knowledge and understanding of the aging process and persons with disabilities.
  • Knowledge of proper food safety and sanitation practices.
  • Ability to plan and organize work effectively.
  • Skill in completing records promptly and accurately.
  • Ability to exercise independent judgment and initiative.
  • Ability to cooperate with people and communicate effectively in person, by phone, and in writing with a variety of groups and individuals.
  • Ability to follow instructions and be flexible.
  • Ability to do general recordkeeping and simple mathematical calculations.
  • Ability to maintain confidentiality of participants.
  • Ability to contribute to a positive work culture that fosters excellent customer service and teamwork.
Compensation:
Starting hourly rate of $15.75. No other benefits are provided for this casual, part-time position.
Special Accommodations:

Marathon County will make arrangements to furnish appropriate auxiliary aids and services where necessary and reasonable to afford an individual with a disability the opportunity to participate in the recruitment process. Please notify the Employee Resources Department office or phone (715) 261-1451 to request special accommodations prior to the application deadline.

Notice to Applicants:

Wisconsin Statutes, Sections 19.36 (7), 64.09 (5), and 64.11 (7) require public employers to treat the following items as a public record: Each applicant’s application, records, recommendations, and qualifications except as provided in Section 19.36 (7), Wis. Stats. that allows the identity of an applicant to remain confidential if the applicant requests in writing that the County not provide access to this information. If you choose not to have this information become a public record, you must make such a request in writing to the Employee Resources Department. doc.title: APD Specialist
doc.description:
We are Farmers!

We are… more than just your favorite commercials. We are a passionate, award winning, equal opportunity employer, committed to the strength of a diverse workforce. We are dedicated to supporting the well-being of our people through our extensive suite of benefits, as well as the well-being of the communities we serve through employee volunteer programs and nonprofit partnerships. Helping others in their time of need isn’t just our business – it’s our culture! We are Farmers!

Do you thrive in a high-volume, fast-paced environment? Do you enjoy the challenge of a position where no two days are alike? We are looking for positive, high-energy professionals who are not just looking for a job, but a meaningful career!

Job Summary

APD Specialist who either completes in-person or virtual inspections and prepares estimates, or proactively reviews and adjusts estimates from repair shops, either Direct Repair or non-Direct repair, and subrogation demands from other carriers. Establishes damages and negotiates settlement of claims with repair facilities and/or customers and works with them to manage repairs and rental. Reviews and resolves supplements. Confirms accuracy of Total Loss evaluations and negotiates settlement with customers or their representative. Communicates and collaborates with Claim Owners to facilitate claim resolution for customers.

Essential Job Functions

Completes vehicle inspections and prepares estimate or reviews and adjusts estimates from repair facilities and subrogation demands using claims estimating software and determines claims related damage. Establishes damages and negotiates settlement of claims with repair facilities or other carriers. Manages repair process and adjusts auto repair supplements and manages rental. Confirms accuracy of total loss evaluation, explains the process and settles total loss claims when appropriate. Obtains total loss salvage release from policyholder or claimant and completes field clearing note before assigning to Salvage department, mitigating additional salvage storage costs. Interacts/collaborates directly with policyholders, claimants, agents, and other representatives including repair facilities. Explains damages and the repair process, and sets expectations. Effectively collaborates with claim owners for customer interaction and resolution strategy. Appropriate communication with all entities associated with the claim to ensure the repairs are completed efficiently. This includes parts availability and appropriate repair scheduling. Confirms, explains, and applies coverage, assists with rental management, determines and reports on subrogation potential, fraud ind icators, negotiates and issues claim payments. Performs applicable administrative tasks (timekeeping, expense reports). Completes assigned training and activities to develop the knowledge, skills and abilities required to complete the job duties. Performs other duties as assigned

Physical Actions

Sits or stands for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Occasionally reaches overhead and below the knees, including bending, twisting, pulling, and stooping. Occasionally moves, lifts, carries, and places objects and supplies weighing 0-10 pounds without assistance. Listens to, interprets, and differentiates auditory information (e.g. others speaking) at normal speaking levels with or without correction. Visually verifies and reads information. Visually locates material, resources and other objects. Ability to continuously operate a computer for extended periods of time, up to a full work shift. Physical dexterity sufficient to use hands, arms, and shoulders repetitively to operate keyboard and other office equipment up to a full work shift.

Physical Environment

Required job duties are normally performed in a climate-controlled office environment, but with exposure to some or all of the following environments when in the field: Uncontrolled outside environmental conditions Excessive Noise Levels Chemicals Chemical/Biological Conditions Moving Mechanical Parts Areas considered to be dangerous Conditions, which could affect the respiratory system or skin such as: fumes, odors, dust, mists, gases, oils, smoke, soot, or poor ventilation

Education Requirements

High School diploma or equivalent required. Bachelor's degree preferred.

Experience Requirements

Basic negotiating skills. Basic interpersonal and communication skills. Basic computer skills. Automotive repair knowledge preferred. Basic conflict resolution skills. Basic critical thinking skills. Actively pursuing I-CAR Platinum designation and technical learning & 3-5 years of estimating experience preferred.

Benefits

  • Farmers offers a competitive salary commensurate with experience, qualifications and location.

o CA Only: $27.42 - $39.66

  • Medical

POSITION SUMMARY:

The Application Architect provides strategic Framework and .NET architectural and technology leadership/oversight for the development, design and architecture of high performing distributed applications and services. This position works closely with business leaders, product experts and application developers to conceptualize, design, develop and deliver solutions and services

Position: Application Architect

Schedule: Full Time

ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES / DUTIES:
  • Responsible for research, evaluation, and recommendation of new software technologies, tools, products, and vendors related to business applications to determine feasibility and desirability of incorporating them within the company's technology and solutions strategy and roadmaps.
  • Proactively researches and tests emerging technologies and tools, presents and documents steps to implement or integrate with existing solutions or applications.
  • Partners with other solution architects to provide a consensus based scalable and adaptable architectural solution
  • Provides leadership and guidance for development and architectural design of operational transaction processing systems and/or services by defining and developing architecture designs, detailed specifications and high level implementation approach.
  • Works with all members of the IT teams and business partners to define solutions with required features and functions. Identifying the right architecture and technology for implementing new solutions.
  • Assist with the development of software technology blue-prints for solutions, design and code for Proof of Concepts to validate and mitigate technical risks.
  • Promotes the use of a shared infrastructure and application roadmaps to reduce technical debt and improve how information flows between business systems
  • Manages and facilitates a review board to evaluate project proposals for architectural fit
  • Provides architectural guidance and leadership on best practices regarding software development, user interface design frameworks, server side development, and integration methods for interoperability, tools and technologies.
  • Supports IT and business teams in analyzing solutions, providing estimates, development, performance, scalability, testing guidance as a technical subject matter expert.

(The above statements in this job description are intended to depict the general nature and level of work assigned to the employee(s) in this job. The above is not intended to represent an exhaustive list of accountable duties and responsibilities required).

JOB REQUIREMENTS

EDUCATION:
  • Bachelor's degree in computer Science, Management Information Systems, related field, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience is required.

CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS REQUIRED:
  • None

EXPERIENCE:
  • A minimum of eight (8) years progressively responsible experience in the development and/or support of enterprise software systems required, including multi-tiered client server and web-based applications, services, and objects.
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience in design and development of software architectural designs and concepts.
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience with Microsoft .NET Framework along with Strong knowledge of architectural principles, frameworks and best practices
  • Experience in healthcare industry preferred
  • Experience with Cognizant's Facets product or similar product preferred.
  • Experience in performance and scalability of highly distributed applications.
  • Experience with .NET, .NET Core, REST, SOAP
  • Experience with SQL server or other relational database
  • Experience with Agile and Waterfall software development approach

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:
  • Effective collaborative and proven process improvement skills.
  • Excellent coordination skills
  • Strong influencing and relationship building skills
  • Demonstrated ability in facilitating cross-functional teams
  • Strong oral and written communication and presentation skills; ability to interact within all levels of the organization.
  • Ability to collaborate with business and technology teams to create practical, robust and scalable architectures and solutions meeting the business and technology goals and strategy of the organization.
  • A strong working knowledge of Microsoft Office products.
  • Demonstrated ability to successfully plan, organize and manage projects
  • Detail oriented, excellent proof reading and editing skills.
  • Strong troubleshooting and problem solving skills.
  • Positive, patient and pro-active team player
  • Ability to learn quickly and work independently
  • Comfortable with ambiguity and willing to take principled bets on new technology

doc.title: Cyber Systems Analyst
doc.description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Cyber Security Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will work in the Cyber Security Section, performing troubleshooting of local government software for system development, scanning, hardening, identifying system vulnerabilities, and conducting system configuration changes to resolve vulnerabilities. You will also be responsible for conducting cybersecurity vulnerability testing, full system evaluation, and documentation. Additionally, you will collaborate with other system administrators and project managers to prevent, respond, mitigate, and recover from cyber-attacks within the urban area.


RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

  • Cybersecurity Equipment and Tools: Ensure the serviceability and integrity of cyber equipment and security tools.
  • Vendor Cyber Solutions: Evaluate vendor cyber solutions, make recommendations, and lead or participate in projects for deployment and/or enhancement of cyber security systems.
  • Operational Security Liaison: Liaise with fusion center, federal, state, local, and critical organizations on operational security matters, requests, and problems.
  • Documentation Management: Maintain documentation on tools, processes, procedures, and playbooks.
  • Cyber Incident Response: Participate as a data-driven contributing member in the cyber incident response team.
  • Threat Hunting: Perform proactive and reactive threat hunting activities including analysis of threat intelligence, detection and evaluation of IoCs and IoAs, and help coordinate incident response and understanding of complex datasets.
  • Cybersecurity Indicators: Review cybersecurity indicators against normal operational security processes and provide notification, response, or escalation.
  • Cybersecurity Subject Matter Expertise: Serve as a data subject matter expert on cybersecurity systems, during cyber incident response, within cyber task force environments, and provide technical assistance on their day-to-day operation, as well as coordinate enhancements to the toolset.
  • Digital Forensics and eDiscovery: Support efforts in digital forensics and eDiscovery.
  • Cyber Program Management: Assist fusion center leadership in managing the cyber program and ensuring consistency with National strategy and guidance.
  • Incident Coordination: Assist in incident coordination through an understanding of security system design tools, methods, and techniques.
  • Training and Outreach: Assist the training and outreach unit by assisting in course coordination and outreach events.
  • Liaison and Outreach Activities: Develop, support, and conduct liaison and outreach activities to Center stakeholders through the participation and development of working groups.
  • Relationship Management: Foster and maintain relationships with local, state, federal, and private sector partners.
  • Vendor Solution Evaluation: Identify, evaluate, and recommend vendor solutions and participate or lead projects that enhance the Center’s cyber security systems.
  • Miscellaneous Duties: Perform other duties related to cyber security, intelligence, investigations, and other missions as directed by Center leadership.

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Employees must adhere to U.S. Federal, State, and Local statutes and regulations due to the sensitive nature of the work. Ongoing eligibility for a U.S. Government clearance and compliance with the Valiant drug screening program is essential. Note that possession, use, or sale/distribution of cannabis or cannabis-based products is disqualifying.
  • This position requires local travel for assessments, briefings, and meetings, with occasional multi-day travel for training and conferences. Be prepared for frequent local/regional day meetings and events.
  • Must possess a valid U.S. driver's license and be willing to travel throughout the U.S. as needed (generally less than 15% of the time).

Salary: The anticipated salary range for this position is between $98,000 and $147,000. However, this is not a guaranteed compensation or salary range; the actual salary will be determined based on factors such as experience, geographic location, and potentially contractual requirements, and it may fall outside of the mentioned range.

Benefits: This position includes a competitive benefits package. Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match (when applicable), Spending Accounts, EAP, Paid time off, Holidays, and additional voluntary benefits.

Position Requirements
  • Technical Skills: Early knowledge of Microsoft Office365, Azure Cloud, and related security concepts, proficiency in scripting languages and PowerShell, and proficiency with data modeling tools such as Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Access, and Microsoft SQL.
  • Enterprise Security: Understanding of enterprise security best practices, including encryption, permissions, multi-factor authentication, auditing and digital forensics, and data retention.
  • Collaboration: Fusion center analysts liaise with state, local, federal partners, and private sector, at times in a classified environment, and must be able to work individually and with varied teams.
  • Analytical Skills: Great analytical skills and ability to apply the MITRE Att&ck Framework and NIST framework in operational security.
  • Communication Skills: Writing and communication skills, including technical documentation, are essential.
  • Fast-Paced Environment: Ability to operate within a fast-paced environment, display strong organizational skills, and maintain a professional demeanor.
  • Compliance: Must agree to comply with training standards and policies associated with the fusion center.
  • Proficiency: Proficiency using basic computer applications, networking devices, threat analysis software, and intelligence related automation.
  • Network Security: Understanding and applying network security concepts, troubleshooting enterprise firewalls, IDS/IPS, DNS Security, and WAF, and understanding network protocols, routing, and switching, LAN/WAN, remote access, and encryption protocols.
  • Email Security: Supporting security control recommendations for email routing and messaging systems, email security gateways, and email encryption.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Security clearance eligibility: Analysts must be eligible to receive a U.S. Government SECRET clearance, up to a TOP Secret clearance level once employed, and maintain it throughout the course of employment. Clearances will be sponsored by the contracting agency.
  • Background check requirement: Must be able to pass an Orange County Sheriff’s Department (OCSD) background check, including a polygraph examination, before commencing employment or performing services at the fusion center.
  • Training and certification: Must agree to comply with training standards and policies associated with the fusion center, and obtain a Basic Intelligence Training Analysis Course (BITAC), Foundations of Intelligence Analysis Training (FIAT), or Critical Thinking and Analytic Methods (CTAM) program certificate or equivalent certification within the first six months of hire as required by federal grant guidelines.
  • Privacy considerations: Individual shall understand privacy considerations, including 28CFR and privacy/civil liberties civil rights (P/CLCR).

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Candidates for this role must have a minimum of four years of experience in Internet/cybersecurity, and possess either a Bachelor's degree in a related discipline or work experience in Cyber Systems in place of a degree.

WORK ENVIRONMENT

  • Analysts will work a 4/10 schedule, with flexibility in start times, and must be willing to adjust their schedule as needed. Some after-hours availability and willingness to respond to the fusion center during an emergency are expected.

doc.title: DVE Intelligence Analyst
doc.description:
As a Domestic Violent Extremism (DVE) Intelligence Analyst, you will be responsible for identifying, creating, and disseminating relevant and actionable intelligence and information related to DVE through analytical reports, briefings, bulletins, and investigative support. Your analytical functions will include researching, analyzing, and reporting on all hazards and domestic terrorism, assessing vulnerabilities, risks, and threats to protect residents, visitors, and critical infrastructure within the area of responsibility (AoR). You will provide predictive analysis based on relevant domestic intelligence, information, trends, or activities. You will develop, support, and conduct liaison and outreach activities across the state, specifically with law enforcement, fire, health, and private and public sector stakeholders. As a DVE Intelligence Analyst, you will provide briefings and reports for multi-disciplined agencies in the public and private sectors regarding DVE, including the identification of potential risks, mitigation strategies, and response planning.


RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES

  • Analyzing DVE Activity: Reviewing and analyzing DVE activity to maintain awareness of current and emerging DVE groups, ideologies, events, and movements in Maryland and surrounding jurisdictions.
  • Identifying DVE Tactics and Techniques: Monitoring and identifying current and emerging tactics, techniques, and procedures associated with domestic violent extremism, including common DVE targets, recruitment methods, fundraising, etc.
  • Communicating DVE Threats: Developing products and briefings to communicate the threat(s) posed by domestic violent extremists within the area of responsibility (AoR).
  • Encouraging Reporting of Suspicious Activity: Developing products and briefings for public safety and critical infrastructure customers to help identify potential indicators of DVE activity and encourage reporting of suspicious activity.
  • Collaborating on Hate/Bias Reporting: Collaborating with public safety agencies focused on hate/bias reporting to determine potential links between hate/bias incidents and domestic violent extremist activity.
  • Conducting Quarterly and Annual Assessments: Contributing to quarterly and annual assessments by relaying the threats, vulnerabilities, consequences, and overall risk stemming from domestic violent extremist activities and organizations.
  • Coordinating with Units and Divisions: Coordinating with all other units and divisions, as well as external partners, to develop tactical and strategic intelligence products.
  • Researching DVE Threat Actors and Organizations: Conducting research using open and sensitive sources to identify potential domestic terrorism threat actor(s) and organizations present in Maryland.
  • Preparing Visual Aids: Creating visual aids such as graphs, charts, and maps to present data to customers.
  • Identifying Intelligence Needs/Trends/Patterns: Identifying and researching intelligence needs, trends, and patterns related to customer needs.
  • Building Relationships: Establishing trusted relationships with appropriate federal, state, local, and non-governmental entities to facilitate information sharing necessary to support DVE analysis.
  • Providing Analysis and Insight: Providing analysis and insight to senior public safety officials and other policymakers related to issues of domestic violent extremism prevention.
  • Supporting DVE Prevention Activities: Providing insight and information to support appropriate federal, state, local, and non-governmental entities in the evaluation and development of DVE prevention activities and initiatives.
  • Collaborating on Intelligence Needs: Collaborating with appropriate federal, state, local, and non-governmental entities to develop DVE-specific key intelligence questions (KIQs) and standing information needs (SINs).
  • Partnering for Outreach and Training: Partnering with other state, local, and federal government agencies to support outreach, liaison, and investigative, liaison, outreach, and training programs.
  • Creating Briefing and Outreach Materials:
  • Developing briefing and outreach materials supporting the mutual sharing of information, including Suspicious Activity Reporting (SAR).

ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Employees must adhere to U.S. Federal, State, and Local statutes and regulations due to the sensitive nature of the work. Ongoing eligibility for a U.S. Government clearance and compliance with the Valiant drug screening program is essential. Note that possession, use, or sale/distribution of cannabis or cannabis-based products is disqualifying.
  • This position requires local travel for assessments, briefings, and meetings, with occasional multi-day travel for training and conferences. Be prepared for frequent local/regional day meetings and events.
  • Must possess a valid U.S. driver's license and be willing to travel throughout the U.S. as needed (generally less than 15% of the time).

Salary: The anticipated salary range for this position is between $70,000 and $142,000. However, this is not a guaranteed compensation or salary range; the actual salary will be determined based on factors such as experience, geographic location, and potentially contractual requirements, and it may fall outside of the mentioned range.

Benefits: This position includes a competitive benefits package. Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match (when applicable), Spending Accounts, EAP, Paid time off, Holidays, and additional voluntary benefits.

Position Requirements
  • Knowledgeable in both classified and open-source research and data analysis methods and techniques.
  • Skilled in collecting, assembling, analyzing, and evaluating evidence, statistics, and other relevant information to draw logical conclusions for effective crime-solving. Proficient in using Arc GIS Mapping, Pen Link or i2 analytical software.
  • Familiar with statistical analysis using Microsoft Excel or SSPS software.
  • Experienced in working with Microsoft Office products (Word, Excel, Access, PowerPoint).
  • Capable of communicating effectively, both orally and in writing, to a wide range and number of audiences.
  • Proficient in working with federal, state and local law enforcement databases.
  • Willing and able to work extended hours as necessary.
  • Knowledgeable in the Intelligence Cycle and Criminal Investigations.
  • Experienced in collecting, analyzing, and disseminating criminal intelligence information.
  • Proficient in researching a voluminous number of databases to identify trends or patterns.
  • Skilled in preparing graphs, charts, tables, maps, and other illustrative devices from collected data or visual presentations.
  • Capable of effectively communicating both in oral and written form.
  • Proficient in understanding and following directives, instructions, and standard operating procedures.

REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS

  • Security clearance eligibility: Analysts must be eligible to receive a U.S. Government SECRET clearance, up to a TOP Secret clearance level once employed, and maintain it throughout the course of employment. Clearances will be sponsored by the contracting agency.
  • Background check requirement: Must be able to pass an Orange County Sheriff’s Department (OCSD) background check, including a polygraph examination, before commencing employment or performing services at the fusion center.
  • Training and certification: Must agree to comply with training standards and policies associated with the fusion center, and obtain a Basic Intelligence Training Analysis Course (BITAC), Foundations of Intelligence Analysis Training (FIAT), or Critical Thinking and Analytic Methods (CTAM) program certificate or equivalent certification within the first six months of hire as required by federal grant guidelines.
  • Privacy considerations: Individual shall understand privacy considerations, including 28CFR and privacy/civil liberties civil rights (P/CLCR).

EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

  • Candidates for this role must have a minimum of three years of DVE Intelligence Analysis experience and either a Bachelor’s degree in a relevant discipline or significant relevant work experience in lieu of a degree.

WORK ENVIORNMENT

  • Flexible work schedule: Analysts will work a 4/10 schedule, with flexibility in start times, and must be willing to adjust their schedule as needed. Some after-hours availability and willingness to respond to the fusion center during an emergency are expected.

doc.title: Healthcare Liaison Officer Program Coordinator
doc.description:
The person in this role will be responsible for coordinating the sharing of health-related information and acting as the primary point of contact for all crimes, threats, risks, and terrorism-related intelligence that affects the health care aspect of the fusion center's operational area. They will also act as a liaison between local, state, and federal health care agencies, private medical groups, public health/medical components, EMS providers, the California State Threat Assessment System (STAS), and the Orange County Health Care Agency (OCHCA) to ensure the local Operational Area (OA) is prepared to identify, report, and respond to criminal and terrorist incidents. Additionally, this individual will work closely with the OCSD Private Sector Coordinator assigned to the Fusion Center.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Central Point of Contact for Health Care Intelligence Sharing: As the Health Liaison Officer-Coordinator (HLO-C), you will serve as the central point of contact for all health care-related crimes, threats, risks, hazards, and terrorism-related intelligence in the Fusion Center AoR.
  • Collaborative Information Dissemination: You will collaborate with Fusion Center management, supervisors, and private sector coordinators to identify and disseminate relevant information to federal, state, tribal, and local stakeholders.
  • Liaison with Health Care Agencies: Acting as a liaison with local, state, and federal health care agencies, private medical groups, public health/medical components, EMS providers, the California State Threat Assessment System (STAS), and the Orange County Health Care Agency (OCHCA), you will ensure that the Fusion Center AoR is equipped to recognize, report, and respond to terrorist incidents and other criminal incidents.
  • Health Stakeholder Training: Working with the outreach unit, you will provide training and educational opportunities to Orange County health stakeholders to maintain up-to-date situational awareness.
  • Medical Intelligence Analysis: You will work with Fusion Center staff to collect, evaluate, analyze, and disseminate medical intelligence that indicates terrorist trends and emerging threats to the public health and medical communities.
  • Network of Healthcare Liaison Officers: Your role will involve developing a network of Healthcare Liaison Officers (HLO) throughout the Fusion Center AoR, including local, state, and federal health care agencies, private health care agencies, EMS providers, Orange County Health Care Agency, and medical institutions.
  • Meetings and Briefings with Health Stakeholders: You will conduct regular meetings and/or briefings with Orange County health stakeholders to maintain situational awareness and establish working relationships with Healthcare Liaison Officers.
  • First Responder Liaison: At the direction of Fusion Center management, you may be asked to respond to locations where you will serve as a liaison between the Fusion Center and first responders on the scene.
  • Intelligence Publication: You will provide viable intelligence and information to all program stakeholders in a regularly distributed publication.
  • Seminar and Training Attendance: Your role will involve attending applicable seminars, conferences, training events, and exercises and assisting in the planning, development, and execution phases of exercises to maintain duty-related knowledge and competencies.
  • Other Duties as Assigned: As the HLO-C, you may be required to carry out any other duties deemed necessary by the Fusion Center Director and/or Deputy Director.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Employees must adhere to U.S. Federal, State, and Local statutes and regulations due to the sensitive nature of the work. Ongoing eligibility for a U.S. Government clearance and compliance with the Valiant drug screening program is essential. Note that possession, use, or sale/distribution of cannabis or cannabis-based products is disqualifying.
  • This position requires local travel for assessments, briefings, and meetings, with occasional multi-day travel for training and conferences. Be prepared for frequent local/regional day meetings and events.
  • Must possess a valid U.S. driver's license and be willing to travel throughout the U.S. as needed (generally less than 15% of the time).

Salary: The anticipated salary range for this position is between $65,000 and $116,000. However, this is not a guaranteed compensation or salary range; the actual salary will be determined based on factors such as experience, geographic location, and potentially contractual requirements, and it may fall outside of the mentioned range.

Benefits: This position includes a competitive benefits package. Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match (when applicable), Spending Accounts, EAP, Paid time off, Holidays, and additional voluntary benefits.

Position Requirements
  • Health Disaster Planning Expertise: The ideal candidate for this position should possess current technical and professional knowledge of health disaster planning, emergency preparedness response and evaluation, hospital/health care center operations, and Orange County's health infrastructure.
  • Policy and Regulation Knowledge: Candidates should also have current knowledge of federal, state, and local policies, regulations, and issues that pertain to the technical and service aspects of the assignment.
  • Collaborative Skills Applicants should have experience in developing and sustaining stakeholder-based collaborative efforts.
  • Understanding of Fusion Center Role: A clear understanding of the unique role of the Fusion Center and the expectations for the Healthcare Liaison Officer Program Coordinator to integrate the program into the Fusion Center is also required.
  • Terrorism Liaison Officer Course Completion: The candidate should complete a fusion center offered Terrorism Liaison Officer course.
  • Research and Analysis Skills The ability to conduct complex professional/technical research and analysis for assigned projects and coordinate such activities with other professional and technical staff is also required.

Required Qualifications:

  • Security clearance eligibility: Must have a U.S. Government SECRET clearance prior to start date, and maintain it throughout the course of employment. Clearances will be sponsored by the contracting agency.
  • Background check requirement: Must be able to pass an Orange County Sheriff’s Department (OCSD) background check, including a polygraph examination, before commencing employment or performing services at the fusion center.
  • Privacy considerations: Individual shall understand privacy considerations, including 28CFR and privacy/civil liberties civil rights (P/CLCR).

Education & Experience:

  • Candidates applying for this position should have at least three years of experience in the healthcare sector or a related field. While not required, those with a Master's degree in public health or a relevant discipline will be given preference. We will also consider significant work experience in lieu of a degree.

Work Environment:

  • Flexible work schedule: Analysts will work a 4/10 schedule, with flexibility in start times, and must be willing to adjust their schedule as needed. Some after-hours availability and willingness to respond to the fusion center during an emergency are expected.

doc.title: Junior Intelligence Analyst
doc.description:
As a Junior-Level Intelligence Analyst, you will collaborate within a federal, state, and local law enforcement and public safety environment, taking on a range of responsibilities. These include conducting initial assessments of raw information, delivering daily oral and written briefings, creating weekly and periodic assessments, and producing bulletins. You will participate in working groups, assist in vetting tips and leads, and disseminate information to various public safety and private sector partners.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Database access: Access various government and non-government databases, sources, and software through unclassified and classified platforms.
  • Fieldwork involvement: Participate in briefings, presentations, trainings, meetings, and on-site analytical assistance as required by partner agencies.
  • Training coordination: Assist the training and outreach unit in coordinating fusion center-related training and outreach events.
  • Threat identification: Review open-source, law enforcement, For Official Use Only, and classified information to identify potential threats impacting the fusion center area.
  • Analysis delivery: Provide verbal and written analysis on domestic and international terrorism, transnational organized crime, cyber, drug trafficking, and other urban area and national priorities.
  • Vetting support: Assist fusion center personnel in initial vetting of tips and leads, ensuring compliance with the National Suspicious Activity Report Initiative and adherence to Privacy/Civil Liberties and Civil Rights standards.
  • Open-source exploration: Conduct in-depth research on real-time open-source analysis sites, linking California and the fusion center area of responsibility with international and domestic events impacting the Anaheim/Santa Ana Urban Area.
  • Analytical product development: Create threat assessments, trends analysis, information bulletins, special event assessments, tactical information, and other analytical products for partner agencies in the urban area.
  • Compliance adherence: Follow professional standards identified by the fusion center, including policies by the Anaheim/Santa Ana UASI and/or Orange County Sheriff’s Department.
  • Relationship building: Foster and maintain relationships with local, state, federal, and private sector partners, collaborating within the community to support the fusion center's mission.

Additional Responsibilities

  • Employees must adhere to U.S. Federal, State, and Local statutes and regulations due to the sensitive nature of the work. Ongoing eligibility for a U.S. Government clearance and compliance with the Valiant drug screening program is essential. Note that possession, use, or sale/distribution of cannabis or cannabis-based products is disqualifying.
  • This position requires local travel for assessments, briefings, and meetings, with occasional multi-day travel for training and conferences. Be prepared for frequent local/regional day meetings and events.
  • Must possess a valid U.S. driver's license and be willing to travel throughout the U.S. as needed (generally less than 15% of the time).

Salary: The anticipated salary range for this position is between $53,000 and $88,000. However, this is not a guaranteed compensation or salary range; the actual salary will be determined based on factors such as experience, geographic location, and potentially contractual requirements, and it may fall outside of the mentioned range.

Benefits: This position includes a competitive benefits package. Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability, Long-Term Disability, 401(k) match (when applicable), Spending Accounts, EAP, Paid time off, Holidays, and additional voluntary benefits.

Position Requirements
  • Interagency liaison: Collaborate with state, local, federal partners, and private sector representatives, at times in a classified environment.
  • Information management: Assist in prioritizing, categorizing, and responding to requests for information.
  • Database searches: Conduct database searches, extract information, and analyze the results.
  • Information source review: Examine a variety of information sources, including Open-Source information and other intelligence disciplines.
  • Technical proficiency: Demonstrate experience using computer-based applications, such as graphics and presentation software, and databases.
  • Compliance: Agree to adhere to training standards and policies associated with the fusion center.
  • Adaptability: Display the ability to work individually and with varied teams, managing multiple priorities and meeting performance standards in a dynamic and demanding environment.
  • Time management: Meet critical and time-sensitive deadlines while providing quality products.
  • Organizational skills: Operate within a fast-paced environment and maintain a professional demeanor.
  • Interpersonal skills: Support liaison efforts with various stakeholders, including state, local and federal partners, as well as other public and private stakeholders.

Required Qualifications:

  • Security clearance eligibility: Analysts must be eligible to receive a U.S. Government SECRET clearance, up to a TOP Secret clearance level once employed, and maintain it throughout the course of employment. Clearances will be sponsored by the contracting agency.
  • Background check requirement: Must be able to pass an Orange County Sheriff’s Department (OCSD) background check, including a polygraph examination, before commencing employment or performing services at the fusion center.
  • Training and certification: Must agree to comply with training standards and policies associated with the fusion center, and obtain a Basic Intelligence Training Analysis Course (BITAC), Foundations of Intelligence Analysis Training (FIAT), or Critical Thinking and Analytic Methods (CTAM) program certificate or equivalent certification within the first six months of hire as required by federal grant guidelines.
  • Privacy considerations: Individual shall understand privacy considerations, including 28CFR and privacy/civil liberties civil rights (P/CLCR).

Education & Experience:

  • A minimum of three years of intelligence analysis experience is required, along with either a Bachelor's degree in a relevant field or substantial relevant work experience that can serve as a substitute for the degree.
  • Analytical product experience: An individual should possess 0-2 years of experience in performing all-source intelligence analysis related to public safety and national security subjects.

Work Environment:

  • Flexible work schedule: Analysts will work a 4/10 schedule, with flexibility in start times, and must be willing to adjust their schedule as needed. Some after-hours availability and willingness to respond to the fusion center during an emergency are expected.
