doc.title: Machine Learning Engineer
doc.description:
The Role

Kindred's ambition is to be the most insight driven gambling company and in the last few years we've invested heavily in our data and analytics capabilities. We are now at the next stage of our journey, building our capability for developing end-to-end machine learning data products, from research conducted by our Data Scientists through to production applications built by our Machine Learning Engineers. We are now looking for a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer to support the development of our Personalisation and Risk Management products for our Kindred Sportsbook Platform.

Our Machine Learning Engineers align with and work closely with Data Scientists in cross-functional product teams and are jointly responsible for the development of high-quality data products. We are currently focusing on areas including personalisation and product risk management and have ambitions to expand our scope to areas including marketing and cyber security in the near future.

Additionally, we are building the core toolset and capability required for our product teams to scale efficiently and iterate rapidly. This includes our Model as a Service deployment platform, developing a feature store for use in both research and production contexts, and building the frameworks we need to monitor and test our products.

What you will do

As a member of our ML Engineering organization, you will have the opportunity to work alongside a team of experienced engineers who specialize in ML operations and data-intensive ML product development. You'll be an integral part of our team, collaborating closely with our Data Science research teams to help them move their models from the research phase into production.

One of your key responsibilities will be to release production-grade ETL processes that will populate our Feature Store. In addition, you'll be deploying models using various paradigms such as batch, stream, and request-response. To ensure that we have a clean, well-tested, and scalable code base, you'll apply the best practices for software development.

Throughout the product lifecycle, you'll be monitoring and supporting our products in collaboration with our Data Scientists. Together, you'll work to ensure that our products meet the highest standards of quality and functionality. Overall, you'll play a crucial role in our team, contributing to the development of cutting-edge ML solutions that make a real impact in the world.


About you

We think that to be successful in this role you will be able to demonstrate many of the following attributes:

✅ 2-4 years relevant commercial experience (e.g., data engineering, data intensive application development, machine learning model development and deployment).

✅ Experience working alongside Data Scientists.

✅ Strong Python engineering skills.

✅ Demonstrable expertise with Apache Spark, specifically using the PySpark API for ETL processes and feature engineering.

✅ Knowledge of GitOps processes for deployment.

✅ Awareness of software development best practice.

✅ Understanding of ML deployment paradigms including batch, event driven, and service.

✅ Excellent interpersonal skills.

✅ A problem-solving growth mindset, with the ability to pick up new concepts quickly.

✅ Passionate about your personal development.


In addition, it will be of benefit if you also have

  • Experience using Spark (including Spark SQL and Streaming).
  • Experience with Kubeflow
  • Experience with Airflow
  • Solid understanding of statistical modelling and machine learning methodologies.
  • A knowledge of enterprise data concepts, including Data Mesh.
  • A knowledge of enterprise service concepts, including Service Mesh.
  • AWS certification.

This position on our Annuity Team provides an exceptional customer experience to our financial advisors. The Annuity Case Manager oversees the application process by working in conjunction with our sales teams, carriers, and others to provide our customers with best-in-class experience while guiding them through product changes, rate updates, and carrier deadlines.

Ability to react to change in a productive and positive manner and a willingness to support your team and accomplish team goals are key components of this position. Our Annuity product offering is a critical piece of our business model and you play a direct role in its success. You will be a part of a team that will continually innovate in finding new ways to support our financial advisors and sales team.

Our successful candidate:
Has Annuity experience in a sales-driven environment and understands products and concepts

Is a team player and works with minimal oversight

Demonstrates strong problem-solving skills and manages multiple priorities

Communicates accurately and professionally in both verbal and written communication with internal and external customers alike

Has strong organizational skills, attention to detail and the ability to stay informed in a rapidly changing environment

Has excellent relationship-building and negotiating skills

Consult on recommendations and solutions for case design with a focus on the customers’ needs

Enter new applications into Agency Management System (AMS) and perform comprehensive review of all new business received

Respond to the client and financial advisor inquiries in a timely and accurate fashion and provide frequent proactive updates as agreed

Position Type/Expected Hours of Work

This is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 8:30am to 5:00pm, with two paid 15-minute breaks and one unpaid 30-minute break for lunch.

About BSMG:
Founded in 1972, Brokers’ Service Marketing Group is a nationally recognized insurance brokerage firm. BSMG is a nationally recognized leader in the life insurance and annuity distribution business. Our clients are insurance professionals, financial advisors, and financial institutions. We have built a reputation as an industry leader that delivers service excellence, doing what’s best for the customer and for fair dealing. Our dynamic team of internal sales specialists works closely with our marketing department and cutting-edge technology to locate highly qualified prospects and turn them lifelong clients.

BSMG is a team of people striving to create memorable experiences, every day. We believe that acting as a fiduciary to the policy holder, providing service excellence and being passionate about what we do every day (even having fun) are all keys to our differentiated business model. We are a trusted resource and partner to thousands of financial advisors, as well as banks, broker dealers and producer groups. BSMG has strong relationships based on mutual respect with the Nation’s leading insurance carriers. BSMG has developed a stellar industry reputation over the past 4 + decades with all of our carrier partners as well as those with whom we do business. BSMG is a dynamic, exciting place to work – being recognized as one of the Best Places to Work in RI in 2019, 2020, and 2021, as well as receiving a Worksite Health Award (superior rating).

doc.title: Senior Panel Consultant
doc.description:
Introduction:

We are seeking a Senior Panel Consultant to support our US Customer Success and Solutions Consulting teams as they design and execute research leveraging our automated insights platform to address the needs of our clients. We work with a variety of panel partners, as well as our clients’ CRM databases, and are always on the lookout for ways to expand our recruiting capabilities. Our clients are some of the world’s leading brands, spanning industries such as Consumer Goods, Healthcare, Financial Services, Higher Education, Retail, Technology and Media.

Are you committed to your work, open to giving and receiving feedback, hungry for empowerment and always taking a hands-on approach? Well then we want to chat. quantilope automates consumer research to unlock high quality insights with speed & ease. We’re a fast growing organization looking for the right people to join our team.

Keep scrolling to learn more...

What you will be doing:


Internal activities:

  • Providing your expertise to our pre- and post-sales research teams in the design and management of sample

  • Ensuring continuous process improvement, education and empowerment of colleagues as it relates to all phases of the panel process

  • Serving as the custodian of data quality - conducting data quality audits, implementing new approaches, proactively sharing panel industry news and building knowledge of data quality measures throughout the team

  • Providing recommendations on panel providers/sample structure for complex projects leveraging your keen understanding of demographics, quota structure, click balancing, targeting capabilities, etc

  • Supporting the technical development and further automation of the field management section in the quantilope platform

External activities:
Serving as the voice of quantilope for panel partners and establishing strong relationships with them, which includes:

  • You are the main point of contact for or panel partners and foster sustainable and effective partnerships

  • Assessing capabilities of, and establishing relationships with, potential new partners with an eye toward expanding existing capabilities

  • Supporting negotiating rate card pricing and building service level agreements with partners

Who you are:

  • You have 7+ years of experience managing/working at market research sample and panel vendors

  • You proactively anticipate potential opportunities and focus on solutions, not problems as they relate to sample management and processes

  • Proactivity is your middle name! You are a do-er with an entrepreneurial spirit - eager to introduce new best-in-class approaches, and jump in to support your colleagues throughout the sampling journey

  • Your outstanding communication skills contribute to your unique ability to educate others on all areas of the sampling process

  • Data quality is your passion! You have a track record of establishing best practices to ensure high levels of data quality and efficiency

  • You are characterised by your strong problem-solving skills and your unbeatable ability to grasp things quickly with a clear focus on goal-oriented solutions

Our team comes from a range of backgrounds and we put emphasis on diversity. Even if you don't fit 100% of our profile or prerequisites, we still encourage you to submit your application.

Estimated base salary range: $95,000-$119,000. Actual compensation package is dependent on a number of factors including experience and market data.
Benefits of working at quantilope:

  • Flexible work environment: With unlimited PTO, flexible working hours and remote/hybrid opportunities, we believe you can succeed from anywhere. Did we mention that everyone has the opportunity to work abroad for up to 6 weeks per year?

  • Ongoing learning: With our dedicated learning budget for every employee and company-wide workshops with the best in the biz, we believe in providing our employees with all the tools they need to excel.

  • Parental leave: Starting or growing your family? We know how important time to bond is, that's why all quantilopers are eligible for 16 weeks fully paid parental leave after a year of employment.

  • Wellness is key: We offer full benefits (health, dental, and vision) as well as regular mental health training, access to Headspace and the support of certified mental health first aiders. We have also just added our Quantiwell days which are global mental health days once a quarter where the whole company takes a day for themselves.

  • Diverse & inclusive community: Our team spans the globe, driving diverse ways of working and thinking. With the help of an incredible DEI committee, we are committed to advancing education and awareness.

  • Planning for the future: At quantilope, we keep your financial wellness top of mind with a 401k program and a 3.5% annual match.

  • Team bonding: Team offsites, summer and holiday parties, global retreats..where in the world will we bring the team together next? We’re all working hard and know how important it is to have fun along the way.


#LI-MB1
About us

quantilope automates consumer research to unlock high-quality insights with speed & ease. Our Insights Automation Platform offers AI-driven advanced quantitative and qualitative solutions to support data-driven decision-making. Founded in 2014, quantilope was named as one of the most innovative tech suppliers for consumer research worldwide (Greenbook GRIT #2 Global Tech Provider) and is one of the fastest growing technology companies in Germany (Deloitte Tech Fast 50, 2021). quantilope powers consumer insights in brand awareness, market segmentation, advertising testing, product concepts, and pricing analysis for over 300 brands including Nestle, Pepsi, Danone, Deutsche Telekom, PBS, OMD, and more.

As a consumer research technology company, we know the importance of diversity not only in our data but also across our team. At quantilope, we celebrate and welcome all people regardless of their gender identity, age, sexual orientation, race, religion, or ethnicity. We strongly believe that best ideas come from sharing and collaborating across diverse perspectives and experiences. Join us and let's see what we can build together.

doc.title: COP Manager (CIP Management Support)
doc.description:
Secure our Nation, Ignite your Future

Become an integral part of a diverse team while working at an Industry Leading Organization, where our employees come first. At ManTech International Corporation, you’ll help protect our national security while working on innovative projects that offer opportunities for advancement.

ManTech has over two decades of history supporting the U.S. Army Europe (USAREUR). We are pleased to announce our recent contract win for the next 5 years.

Currently, ManTech is seeking a motivated, career and customer-oriented COP / CIP Management Support (COP Manager) to join our team in the Stuttgart, Germany .

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Coordinating with EUCOM component commands to enforce COP reporting requirements IAW Joint Staff and EUCOM directives.

  • Coordinating with the Joint Intelligence Operations Center Europe (JIOCEUR) Analytic Center (JAC) to ensure intelligence data is meeting Commander's Critical Information Requirements (CCIR's) and Priority Intelligence Requirements (PIR's).

  • Utilizing GCCS FoS client applications such as ICSF and Agile Client to manage the Theater COP, to include the development of overlays, KML files, and other Tactical Decision Aids (TDA's), track latency, and track display filtering.

  • Maintaining, monitoring, and troubleshooting all COP Sync Tools (CST) connections with higher, lower, and adjacent commands and agencies.

  • Maintaining, monitoring, and troubleshooting data feeds with Cross Domain Solutions (CDS) to maintain coalition and partner nation COP data feeds.

  • Maintaining, monitoring, and troubleshooting Theater Missile Warning (TMW) data feeds and utilizes GCCS FoS Theater Ballistic Missile Defense (TBMD) tools and applications to facilitate desired visualization of theater missile threats.

  • Maintaining a reliable track database, by resolving ambiguities within the database, locating specified tracks and deletion of track IAW with EUCOM directives.

  • Manipulating the display and map products to support mission requirements.

  • Associating intelligence tracks where applicable.

  • Serving as liaison satisfying end user requirements and assists in data collection.

  • Identifying, analyzing and defining problems associated with the COP system.

Basic Qualifications:

  • Expert knowledge of GCCS FoS (GCCS-J, GCCS-A, GCCS-M, GCCS-AF, Agile Client, ICSF) to create and manage a Common Operating Picture to include Integrated Intelligence and Imagery (I3), and Joint Operational Planning and Execution System (JOPES).

  • Expert Knowledge of Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA) GCCS related Program of Record tools: Agile Client, Integrated Command, Control, Communications, Computers, & Intelligence (C4I) System Framework (ICSF)

  • Expert knowledge of GCCS related peripheral devices and systems such as: workstation and laptop hardware, network devices, HTML, KML, FTP, IRC, Newsgroups

  • Knowledge of Windows, Solaris, and LINUX operating systems.

  • Knowledge of commercial geospatial information systems such as Google Earth and ArcGIS.

  • Knowledge of COP communications and architectures, such as COP Sync Tools (CST), Multi-TADIL Capability (MTC)/LINK, and GALE/GLIS.

  • Knowledge of a wide range of Information Technology (IT)/Information Systems (IS) and communication concepts, principles, and practices to plan and develop COP strategies to meet short-, mid-, and long-range needs, plans, goals and objectives.

  • Knowledge of automation techniques, software, hardware and applications to meet end user requirements.

  • Knowledge of integrating COP products from applications such as GCCS-J I3, JEM/JWARN, MTI, and JTT.

  • Working knowledge of DoDI, DoDD, CJCSI, and EUCOM directives and regulations, and specific program guidelines to include a complete understanding of EUCOM program policies and procedures covering EUCOM AOR and mission requirements combined with possession of analytical ability to participate in the planning and execution of a variety of operational and contingency exercise missions.

  • Experience working with USMTF formatted messages, such as JUNIT, OTH-Gold, OBREP, MISREP, SPIREP, RECEXXREP, etc.

  • Experience using GCCS FoS communications to share data via USMTF messages, such as NETWORK Channel and AUTO-FWD/Broadcast.

  • Experience integrating and managing BFT/FFT devices into the COP.

  • Experience creating KML data products / layers with Google Earth or other similar web-based geospatial display engine.

  • Must be able to obtain an ITIL Foundations 4 certification within the first 90 days of employment on this program.

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Attended JDTC GCCS-J COP, I3 Operator or COP Manager MTT or resident courses.

Security Clearance Requirements:

  • Must be a U.S. Citizen with an Active TS/SCI Security Clearance.

POC: If interested, please apply to this position online/upload your resume and also directly contact our EMITS Recruiting Lead, David Muskheli, David.Muskheli@ManTech.com (please send copy of your resume and certifications).

Contract: ManTech has been working on this program for over 10 years and we’re continuing our important work on the EMITS contract, a brand new, fully funded 5-year contract that begins on 1 Feb 2021.

doc.title: PATENTING OPERATOR - Ohio
doc.description:
We are looking for an experienced production line operator to join our team at ASWPENGG.

Job Title: PATENTING OPERATOR

Job Duties & Responsibilities:

The operator will run, monitor, and quality-check parts throughout the patenting line. will use available controls to maintain the appropriate equipment parameter for processing customer work. Including reading and following instructions given on the order paperwork, following requirements of ASWPENGG’S Quality Management System, understanding is written work instructions, and the ability to operate machines accordingly.Complete all required fields on the shop router paperwork accurately and consistently and track the orders into the floor tracking system. Check production planning and ensure the machine is running as per schedule. Ensure proper tagging of material at take up. Ensure material availability for the next run as per the job schedule and stage material next to the respective line. Ensure finished material is weighed and shifted to their individual/designated area.

Education and/or Required Knowledge and Skills:

· High School, GED, or Associate Degree

· Strong mechanical aptitude and ability to effectively use hand tools

Physical Requirements:

· Ability to safely and successfully perform the essential job functions consistent with ADA, FMLA, and other federal, state, and local standards, including meeting qualitative and/or quantitative productivity standards.

· Ability to maintain regular, punctual attendance consistent with ADA, FMLA, and other federal, state, and local standards.

· Must be able to lift and carry up to 50 lbs.

· Must be able to drive a forklift.

· Must be able to work in extreme heat. Job duties include maintaining kettles which can consist of working nearby of a 1250F-degree kettle.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $16.00 - $18.00 per hour

Schedule:

  • Day shift
  • Night shift

Application Question(s):

  • Do you have reliable transportation to go to work?

Education:

  • High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Work Location: One location

doc.title: Maintenance Tech
doc.description:
Job Description

At Palladium, we strive to service our residents with quality and excellence in customer service. To join our team, you must have an eye for details, be willing to contribute in all areas, have a flexible schedule and a drive to go above-and-beyond.

Floating Maintenance Technician

The Maintenance Technician can expect to be involved directly in completing various maintenance or repair responsibilities. This position often requires considerable physical exertion in performing tasks related to the repair and maintenance of the building, grounds, mechanical, plumbing, HVAC, electrical, and electronic systems of the property. Good communication, hygiene and customer service skills are necessary at all times.

Other requirements

  • Valid driver’s license
  • High School diploma or equivalent
  • Reliable vehicle and insurance is required
  • Local vehicle travel is required
  • On call as needed
  • Minimum 2 years apartment maintenance experience
  • Strong construction background
  • Experienced in completing work orders and make ready unit
  • Experienced in appliance repair
  • Active 07B Residential Electrical Maintenance Certification preferred
  • Working knowledge of maintenance tools required to perform job duties
  • Excellent customer service skills

Duties

  • Oversee vendors
  • Utilizes work order software
  • Select, train, and evaluate maintenance team
  • Develop specifications for work to be completed
  • Continuously review contracts/agreements with vendors who provide supplies or ongoing services. Recommend changes with property manager and Asset Manager.
  • Manage area of budget related to the maintenance of the community.
  • Assign and ensure that office staff have information they need in order to respond effectively to questions from residents, particularly if the repair will be delayed for any reason.
  • Evaluate bids with the property manager and determine which vendors will be selected
  • Achieves high productivity through reliable and punctual attendance and report any tardiness, attendance, and disciplinary issues to the property manager.
  • Ensures that work order requests are responded to promptly and professionally.
  • Diagnoses problems and repairs in the areas of HVAC, electrical, plumbing, swimming pool, carpentry, dry walling, exterior structural, and appliances.
  • Provides on-call pager service when scheduled and performs emergency maintenance work when required.
  • Inspects buildings and grounds to ensure safety and cleanliness, and alerts Maintenance to items that need to be repaired.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $22.00 per hour

Benefits:

  • 401(k)
  • Dental insurance
  • Health insurance
  • Paid time off
  • Vision insurance

Schedule:

  • On call
  • Weekend availability

Experience:

  • Maintenance: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

doc.title: Inventory & PPE Accountant
doc.description:
Neptuno has over 20 years leading the Telecommunication industry and we are one of the largest and most comprehensive wireless broadband service providers in Puerto Rico and the USVI.

We have an opportunity for an Inventory & PPE Accountant to join our team.

The Inventory & PPE Accountant identifies and keeps record of company equipment, buildings, and other property. Compiles and maintains records of quantity, type, and value of material, equipment, merchandise, or supplies stocked in establishment by performing the following duties.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Control all inventory activities and fixed assets
  • Records description, value, location, and other pertinent information of each item
  • Designs and implements record keeping system to manage all necessary data
  • Maintain and update inventory records
  • Reconcile inventory discrepancies
  • Conduct Cycle Count inventory processes to ensure accuracy and timely execution
  • Conducts periodic inventories of the PPE equipment to keep records current and ensure that equipment is properly maintained
  • Prepares statements reflecting monthly appreciated and depreciated values
  • Collect and analyze data related to the efficient movement and accuracy of inventory

Qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree in Accounting
  • Minimum of a 5 years in a similar position
  • Microsoft Dynamics GP experience is a plus

Core Competencies:

  • Strong Inventory Control Experience
  • Knowledge of finance and accounting principles and best practices
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to communicate to management, support personnel and clients
  • Strong attention to detail as well as strong organizational skills
  • Action-oriented and self-driven
  • Ability to collaborate, work with teams and take initiative when appropriate
  • Strong organizational, execution and analytical skills
  • Ability to multi-task, prioritize and manage multiple deliverables
  • Willingness to work hard and take direction
  • Proficiency in Excel
  • Fully Bilingual (English and Spanish)

Neptuno is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: $34,000.00 - $38,000.00 per year

Benefits:

  • Employee assistance program
  • Health insurance
  • Retirement plan

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

doc.title: Machine/Process Operator, Afternoon Shift, up to $26/hr. w/shift differential
doc.description:
Meyer Utility Structures, an Arcosa subsidiary, is searching for a Machine/Process Operator for our Hager City, WI plant. Depending on experience, an Operator can earn up to $25/hr. base pay plus a $1/hr. shift differential. There are three pay levels for Operators depending on experience - Entry Level, Mid-Level and Expert Level with a wage range of $21-$25/hr. PLUS $1/hr. more for afternoon shift. The Machine/Process Operator is responsible for operating all assigned machinery in an industrial setting to achieve the throughput needed to support the business unit’s needs.


Meyer Utility Structures is an industry leader in the engineering design and fabrication of concrete, lattice, and tubular steel structures for transmission, distribution, and substation applications. With over sixty years of innovative engineering and manufacturing expertise, Meyer has helped to author and validate many of today’s transmission industry standards and specifications.


What you’ll do:

  • Ensure machine(s) are in good working order, following all OSHA pre-checks and inspections.
  • Follow all work instructions and procedures concerning safety, proper machine operations and job specific instructions to ensure quality guidelines are met
  • Keep work area clean and act with versatility while working with sheet metal (and various other structural materials) cutting, shaping, forming, drilling, seaming, pressing and grinding
  • Responsible for moving and transporting work product with various types of cranes, lifting vehicles and conveyance tools
  • BE SAFE – at all times
  • Obtain sign-off on all jobs performed
  • Work with various heavy machinery and power hand tools to form metal into various parts
  • Operate forklift, remote overhead and jib cranes and other conveyance tools
  • Load and unload work and supplies from trucks and other vehicles
  • Assist other qualified operators as needed
  • May become involved in a safety committee/team –safety classes and work best practices
  • Other duties as directed

What you’ll need:

  • Enthusiasm – we will train the you if you are willing to put the hard work into learning the skills needed
  • Experience in a welding fabrication shop, metals shop, using heavy power tools to cut press, drill, or form metal – or basic welding skills is a plus
  • Experience in a manufacturing, light industrial, industrial, CNC or melt shop setting is a plus
  • Experience with remote overhead cranes and lifting vehicles, or driving medium to heavy equipment is a plus
  • Ability to follow directions and read instructions
  • Ability to maintain good attendance and be on time to work
  • High School diploma or GED preferred but not necessary - job experience and/or the right attitude equivalent as deemed by Management
